analyzed: agniṣṭomam ca yajñānām nirmame prathamān mukhāt
translated: And the Agnistoma sacrifice - he created these from his eastern mouth.

original: yajūṃṣi traiṣṭubhaṃ chandaḥ stomaṃ pañcadaśaṃ tathā /
analyzed: yajūṃṣi traiṣṭubham chandaḥ stomam pañcadaśam tathā
translated: The Yajur Veda, the Tristubh meter, the fifteen-fold stoma,

analyzed: bṛhatsāma tathā uktam ca dakṣiṇāt saḥ sṛjat mukhāt
translated: The Brihat and Bṛhadrathantara Sāmans - he created these from his southern mouth.

original: sāmāni jagatīṃ caiva stomaṃ saptadaśaṃ tathā /
analyzed: sāmāni jagatīm ca eva stomam saptadaśam tathā
translated: The Sāman chants, the Jagati meter, the seventeen-fold stoma,

analyzed: vairūpyam atirātram ca paścimāt saḥ sṛjat makhāt
translated: The Vairūpa and Atirātra sacrifices - he created these from his western mouth.

analyzed: ekaviṃśam atharvāṇam āptoryāmam tathā eva ca
translated: The Ekavimsa and Atharva Veda, the Aptoryāma sacrifice,

analyzed: anuṣṭubham sa vairājam caturthāt asṛjat mukhāt
translated: The Anustubh meter, and the Vairāja Sāman - he created these from his fourth mouth.

analyzed: vidyutaḥ śani meghāṃśu rohita idra dhanūṃṣi ca
translated: The lightning, thunder, clouds, rain, the red and white clouds, and the rainbows,

analyzed: sṛṣṭvā asau bhagavān devaḥ parjanyam iti viśrutam
translated: Having created these, the illustrious god became known as Parjanya.

analyzed: ṛcaḥ yajūṃṣi sāmāni nirmame yajña siddhaye
translated: For the accomplishment of sacrifices, he created the Richs, the Yajuses, and the Samans.

analyzed: uccāvacāni bhūtāni gātrebhyaḥ tasya jajñire
translated: From his body were born all kinds of creatures, high and low.

analyzed: brahmaṇā astu prajā sargam sṛjataḥ hi prajāpateḥ
translated: When Brahman, the lord of created beings, was engaged in the creation of living creatures,

analyzed: sṛṣṭvā catuṣṭayam pūrvam deva ṛṣi pitṛ mānavān
translated: having first created the four classes, the gods, the Rishis, the Pitris, and men,

analyzed: tatas sṛjata bhūtāni carāṇi sthāvarāṇi ca
translated: he then created all creatures, mobile and immobile.

analyzed: sṛṣṭvā yakṣa piśācān ca gandharva psarasaḥ tadā
translated: Having created Yakshas and Pishachas, Gandharvas and Apsaras,

analyzed: nara kinnara rakṣāṃsi vayaḥ paśu mṛga uragān
translated: men, Kinnaras, Rakshasas, birds, beasts, and snakes,

original: avyayaṃ ca vyayaṃ caiva dvayaṃ sthāvarajaṅgamam // / / //🔽teṣāṃ ye yāni karmāṇi prāk sṛṣṭāni prapedire /
analyzed: avyayam ca vyayam ca eva dvayam sthāvara jaṅgamam  teṣām ye yāni karmāṇi prāk sṛṣṭāni prapedire
translated: the perishable and the imperishable, the two classes of creatures, mobile and immobile,🔽those that were born in the beginning, and those that were created afterwards,

analyzed: tāni eva pratipadyante sṛjyamānāḥ punar punar
translated: they all follow the same occupations which they followed before.

analyzed: hiṃsra ahiṃsre sṛjan krūre dharma adharma āvṛta anṛte
translated: Creating the violent and the non-violent, the cruel, the righteous, the unrighteous, the truthful and the false,

original: tadbhāvitāḥ prapadyante tasmāttattasya rocate // / / //🔽mahābhūteṣu nānātvamindriyārteṣu mūrtiṣu /
analyzed: tad bhāvitāḥ prapadyante tasmāt tat tasya rocate  mahābhūteṣu nānātvam indriya ārteṣu mūrtiṣu
translated: they are born again and again, and are born with the same dispositions.🔽The Creator himself assigned to the different elements, the different functions which they perform in the bodies of embodied creatures.

analyzed: viniyogam ca bhūtānām dhātā eva vyadadhāt svayam
translated: The different functions of the different elements, the different forms of the different bodies,🔽the Creator himself assigned to the different elements.

original: kecitpuruṣakāraṃ tu prāhuḥ karma ca mānavāḥ /
analyzed: kecid puruṣakāram tu prāhuḥ karma ca mānavāḥ
translated: Some men say that action is due to human effort,

analyzed: daivam iti apare viprāḥ svabhāvam bhūta cintakāḥ
translated: while other Brahmins, contemplating the elements, say it is destiny.

analyzed: pauruṣam karma daivam ca phala vṛtti svabhāvataḥ
translated: Action, human effort, and destiny, according to their nature, lead to results.

original: na caiva tu pṛthagbhāvamadhikena tato viduḥ // / / //
analyzed: na ca eva tu pṛthagbhāvam adhikena tatas viduḥ
translated: But they know that they are not separate, but are due to something more.

original: etadevaṃ ca naivaṃ ca na cobhe nānubhe na ca /
analyzed: etat evam ca na evam ca na ca ubhe na anubhe na ca
translated: This is so, and not so, and both, and neither,

analyzed: sva karma viṣayam brūyuḥ sattva sthāḥ sama darśinaḥ
translated: the self-controlled, impartial ones say that it is the domain of one's own action.

original: nānārūpaṃ ca bhūtānāṃ kṛtānāṃ ca prapañcanam /
analyzed: nānā rūpam ca bhūtānām kṛtānām ca prapañcanam
translated: The manifold forms of beings and the elaboration of what is done,

analyzed: veda śabdebhyaḥ eva ādau nirmame sa maheśvaraḥ
translated: Maheshvara first created them from the words of the Vedas.

original: ārṣāṇi caiva nāmāni yāśca deveṣu dṛṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: ārṣāṇi ca eva nāmāni yāḥ ca deveṣu dṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: The names of the Rishis and the views of the gods,

analyzed: śarvarī ante prasūtānām punar tebhyaḥ dadhāti ajaḥ
translated: the unborn one again bestows them on those born at the end of the cosmic age.

original: iti śrībrahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyuprokte pūrvabhāge dvitīye 'nuṣaṅgapāde mānasasṛṣṭivarṇanaṃ nāmāṣṭamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī brahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyu prokte pūrva bhāge dvitīye nuṣaṅga pāde mānasasṛṣṭivarṇanam nāma aṣṭamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eighth chapter, in the first section of the Vayupurana, in the Mahabharata, of the narrated description of the mental creation.

analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

original: rudraṃ dharmaṃ manaścaiva ruciṃ caivākṛtiṃ tathā /
analyzed: rudram dharmam manaḥ ca eva rucim ca eva ākṛtim tathā
translated: Rudra, Dharma, Mind, Desire, and Form,

original: pañca kartṝn hi sa tadā manasā vyasṛjatprabhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: pañca kartṝn hi sa tadā manasā vyasṛjat prabhuḥ
translated: The Lord then mentally created five agents.

analyzed: ete mahā bhujāḥ sarve prajānām sthiti hetavaḥ
translated: All these great arms are the causes of the sustenance of beings.

original: auṣadhīḥ pratisaṃdhatte rudraḥ kṣīṇaḥ punaḥ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: auṣadhīḥ pratisaṃdhatte rudraḥ kṣīṇaḥ punar punar
translated: Rudra, having become exhausted again and again, takes up the herbs.

analyzed: prāpta oṣadhi phalaiḥ devaḥ samyak iṣṭaḥ phala arthibhiḥ  tribhiḥ eva kapālaiḥ tu tryaṃbakaiḥ oṣadhī kṣaye
translated: The God, having obtained the fruits of the herbs, is properly worshipped by those desiring fruits.🔽Because he is worshipped by the sages with only three skulls, due to the exhaustion of the herbs,

analyzed: ijyate munibhiḥ yasmāt tasmāt tryaṃbakaḥ ucyate
translated: he is therefore called Tryambaka.

original: gāyatrīṃ caiva triṣṭup ca jagatī caiva tāḥ smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: gāyatrīm ca eva triṣṭubh ca jagatī ca eva tāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The Gayatri, the Tristubh, and the Jagati are known as those.

analyzed: aṃbikānām mayā proktāḥ yonayaḥ svanaspateḥ
translated: The wombs of Ambika have been mentioned by me, of the Lord of the trees.

analyzed: tābhiḥ eka tva bhūtāḥ bhiḥ trividhābhiḥ sva vīryataḥ  tri sādhanaḥ puroḍāśaḥ tri kapālaḥ tatas smṛtaḥ
translated: By those three kinds, which are of one nature, due to his own power,🔽the sacrificial cake is threefold, therefore it is known as Trikapala.

analyzed: tryaṃbakaḥ sa puroḍāśaḥ tena iha tryaṃbakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: He is Tryambaka, the sacrificial cake, therefore he is known here as Tryambaka.

original: dhatte dharmaḥ prajāḥ sarvā mano jñānakaraṃ smṛtam /
analyzed: dhatte dharmaḥ prajāḥ sarvāḥ manaḥ jñāna karam smṛtam
translated: Dharma supports all beings, the mind is known as the maker of knowledge.

original: ākṛtiḥ suruce rūpaṃ ruciḥ śraddhākaraḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ākṛtiḥ su ruceḥ rūpam ruciḥ śraddhākaraḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Form is known as Suruchi, and faith is known as Ruci.

analyzed: evam ete prajāpālāḥ prajānām sthiti hetavaḥ
translated: Thus these lords of creatures are the causes of the existence of creatures.

analyzed: atha asya sṛjataḥ sargam prajānām parivṛddhaye
translated: Then, for the increase of creatures, he created this creation.

original: na vyavarddhata tāḥ sṛṣṭāḥ prajāḥ kenāpi hetunā /🔽tataḥ sa vidadhe buddhimarthaniścayagā minīm // / / //
analyzed: na vyavarddhata tāḥ sṛṣṭāḥ prajāḥ kena api hetunā  tatas sa vidadhe buddhim artha niścaya gāminīm
translated: The created creatures did not increase for some reason.🔽Then he made up his mind to determine the purpose.

analyzed: atha ātmani samadrākṣīt tamaḥ mātrām tu cāriṇīm
translated: Then he saw in himself only the moving darkness,

analyzed: rajaḥ sattvam parityajya vartamānām sva karmataḥ
translated: existing by its own action, having abandoned passion and goodness.

original: tataḥ sa tena dukhenaśucaṃ cakre jagatpatiḥ /🔽tamaśca vyanudatpaścād rajasātu samāvṛṇot // / / //
analyzed: tatas sa tena dukhena aśucam cakre jagatpatiḥ  tamaḥ ca vyanudat paścāt rajasātu samāvṛṇot
translated: Then the lord of the world became distressed by that sorrow.🔽Then he dispelled the darkness and covered it with passion.

analyzed: tat tamaḥ pratinuttam vai mithunam saṃprasūyata
translated: When the darkness was dispelled, a couple was born.

analyzed: adharma ācaraṇāt tasya hiṃsā śokaḥ vyajāyata
translated: From its unrighteous conduct, violence and grief were born.

analyzed: tatas tasmin samudbhūte mithune varaṇa ātmake
translated: Then, when that couple consisting of Varuna and Varuna was born,

original: tataḥ sa bhagavānāsīt prītaścaitaṃ hi śiśriye // / / //🔽evaṃ prītātmanastasya svadehārddhādviniḥsṛtā /
analyzed: tatas sa bhagavān āsīt prītaḥ ca etam hi śiśriye  evam prīta ātmanaḥ tasya sva deha arddhāt viniḥsṛtā
translated: then the lord became pleased and resorted to this.

analyzed: nārī parama kalyāṇī sarva bhūta manoharā
translated: Thus, from the half of his own body, a supremely beautiful woman, captivating the minds of all beings,🔽emerged from him, whose soul was pleased.

original: sā hi kāmātmanā sṛṣṭā prakṛteḥ sā surūpiṇī /
analyzed: sā hi kāma ātmanā sṛṣṭā prakṛteḥ sā surūpiṇī
translated: She was created by the Self-existent One, the Supreme Being, for the gratification of the desires of the gods. She was of beautiful form.

original: śatarūpeti sā proktā sā proktaiva punaḥ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śatarūpā iti sā proktā sā proktā eva punar punar
translated: She was called Shatarupa. She was again and again spoken of as such.

original: tataḥ prajāḥ samudbhūtā yathā proktā mayā purā /
analyzed: tatas prajāḥ samudbhūtāḥ yathā proktāḥ mayā purā
translated: Then the creatures were produced as described by me before.

analyzed: prakriyāyām yathā tubhyam tretā madhye mahātmanaḥ
translated: In the Prakriti, in the middle of the Treta age, to the great one, as has been told to you.

original: yadā prajāstu tāḥ sṛṣṭā na vyavaddhata dhīmataḥ /
analyzed: yadā prajāḥ tu tāḥ sṛṣṭāḥ na vyavaddhata dhīmataḥ
translated: When those creatures were created, the wise one did not become attached.

analyzed: tatas nyān mānasān putrān ātmanaḥ sadṛśaḥ sṛjata
translated: Then he created other mental sons, similar to himself.

analyzed: bhṛgu aṅgiraḥ marīcīn ca pulastyam pulaham kratum
translated: Bhrigu, Angiras, Marichi, Pulastya, Pulaha, Kratu,

analyzed: dakṣam atrim vasiṣṭham ca nirmame mānasān sutān
translated: Daksha, Atri, and Vasishtha, he created these mental sons.

original: nava brahmāṇa ityete purāṇe niścayaṃ gatāḥ /
analyzed: nava brahmāṇaḥ iti ete purāṇe niścayam gatāḥ
translated: These nine Brahmas are ascertained in the Puranas.

analyzed: brahmā yata ātmakānām tu sarveṣām ātmayoninām
translated: Brahma, who is self-born and has controlled his mind, of all those who are self-born.

analyzed: tatas sṛjat punar brahmā dharmam bhūta sukha āvaham
translated: Then Brahma again created Dharma, who brings happiness to all beings,

analyzed: prajāpatim rucim ca eva pūrveṣām eva pūrvajau
translated: and Prajapati and Ruci, who are the eldest of the former ones.

analyzed: buddhitaḥ sasṛje dharmam sarva bhūta sukha āvaham
translated: From his mind, he created Dharma, who brings happiness to all beings.

analyzed: manasaḥ tu ruciḥ nāma jajñe jaḥ vyakta janmanaḥ
translated: From the mind of the one born from the unmanifest, Ruci was born.

analyzed: bhṛguḥ tu ṛṣiḥ sālala yoninaḥ
translated: Bhrigu was born from the heart of the lotus-born Rishi.

original: prāṇāddakṣaṃ sṛjanbrahmā cakṣurbhyāṃ tu marīcinam // / / //🔽abhimānātmakaṃ rudraṃ nirmame nīlalohitam /
analyzed: prāṇāt dakṣam sṛjan brahmā cakṣurbhyām tu marīcinam  abhimāna ātmakam rudram nirmame nīlalohitam
translated: Creating Daksha from his vital airs, Brahma created Marichi from his eyes,🔽and the blue-red Rudra, who is of the nature of ego.

analyzed: śirasā uṃgirasam ca eva śrotrāt atrim tathā eva ca
translated: From his head he created Angiras, from his ears Atri,

analyzed: pulastyam ca tathā udānāt vyānāt ca pulaham punar
translated: and from his Udana he created Pulastya, and from his Vyana he created Pulaha.

analyzed: samāna jaḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ ca hi apānāt nirmame kratum
translated: From his Samana was born Vasishtha, and from his Apana he created Kratu.

original: ityete brahmaṇaḥ putrāḥ prajādau dvādaśa smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: iti ete brahmaṇaḥ putrāḥ prajā ādau dvādaśa smṛtāḥ
translated: Thus these twelve sons of Brahma are known as the first creators of beings.

analyzed: dharmaḥ teṣām prathama jaḥ devatānām smṛtaḥ tu vai
translated: Among them, Dharma is known as the eldest and the creator of the gods.

original: bhṛgvādayastu ye sṛṣṭāste vai brahmarṣayaḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: bhṛgu ādayaḥ tu ye sṛṣṭāḥ te vai brahmarṣayaḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: But Bhrigu and others who were created are known as Brahma-rishis.

analyzed: gṛhamedhi purāṇāḥ te dharmaḥ taiḥ prāk pravarttitaḥ
translated: They are the ancient householders, and Dharma was first propagated by them.

original: dvādaśaite prasūyante prajāḥ kalpe punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: dvādaśa ete prasūyante prajāḥ kalpe punar punar
translated: These twelve are born again and again to create beings in every Kalpa.

original: teṣāṃ dvādaśa te vaṃśā divyā devaguṇānvitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: teṣām dvādaśa te vaṃśāḥ divyāḥ deva guṇa anvitāḥ
translated: Their twelve dynasties are divine and endowed with divine qualities.

analyzed: kriyāvantaḥ prajāvantaḥ mahā ṛṣibhiḥ alaṅkṛtāḥ
translated: They are engaged in rituals, have offspring, and are adorned with great sages.

analyzed: yadā taiḥ iha sṛṣṭaiḥ tu dharmma ādyaiḥ ca mahā ṛṣibhiḥ
translated: When the great sages, Dharma and others, were created by him here,

analyzed: sṛjyamānāḥ prajāḥ ca eva na vyavarddhanta dhīmataḥ
translated: and the created beings did not multiply, the wise one

analyzed: tamaḥ mātrā vṛtaḥ saḥ bhūt śoka pratihataḥ ca vai
translated: was enveloped by mere darkness and obstructed by grief.

original: yathā'vṛtaḥ sa vai brahmā tamomātrā tu sā punaḥ /
analyzed: yathā āvṛtaḥ sa vai brahmā tamaḥ mātrā tu sā punar
translated: As Brahmā was thus enveloped, that mere darkness again

analyzed: putrāṇām ca tamaḥ mātrā aparā niḥsṛtā abhavat
translated: emerged as another mere darkness of his sons.

original: pratisrotātmako 'dharmo hiṃsā caivāśubhātmikā /🔽tataḥ pratihate tasya pratīte varaṇātmake // / / //
analyzed: pratisrota ātmakaḥ dharmaḥ hiṃsā ca eva aśubha ātmikā  tatas pratihate tasya pratīte varaṇa ātmake
translated: Adharma, which has the nature of going against the current, and violence, which has an inauspicious nature,🔽Then, when that [darkness] was obstructed and the form of obstruction was realized,

original: svāṃ tanuṃ sa tadā brahmā samapohata bhāsvarām /
analyzed: svām tanum sa tadā brahmā samapohata bhāsvarām
translated: Brahmā then removed his own radiant body.

analyzed: dvidhā kṛtvā svakam deham arddhena puruṣaḥ
translated: Having divided his own body in two, with one half he became a man,

original: ardhena nārī sā tasya śatarūpā vyajāyata /
analyzed: ardhena nārī sā tasya śatarūpā vyajāyata
translated: and with the other half a woman, that Śatarūpā was born to him.

analyzed: prakṛtiḥ bhūta dhātrī sā kāmāt vai sṛjataḥ prabhoḥ
translated: That Prakṛti, the nourisher of beings, was born from the lord's desire to create.

original: sā divaṃ pṛthivīṃ caiva mahimnā vyāpya susthitā /
analyzed: sā divam pṛthivīm ca eva mahimnā vyāpya susthitā
translated: She, pervading heaven and earth with her greatness, remained well-established.

original: brahmāṇaḥ sā tanuḥ pūrvā divamāvṛtya tiṣṭataḥ // / / //
analyzed: brahmāṇaḥ sā tanuḥ pūrvā divam āvṛtya tiṣṭataḥ
translated: That former body of Brahmā, having covered heaven, remained there.

original: yā tvarddhā sṛjyate nārī śatarūpā vyajāyata /
analyzed: yā tu arddhā sṛjyate nārī śatarūpā vyajāyata
translated: But that half which was created as a woman, Śatarūpā, was born.

original: sā devī niyutaṃ taptvā tapaḥ parama duścaram // / / //
analyzed: sā devī niyutam taptvā tapaḥ parama duścaram
translated: That goddess, having performed austerities for a myriad years, extremely difficult to perform,

analyzed: bharttāram dīpta yaśasam puruṣam pratyapadyata
translated: obtained a husband, a man of blazing fame.

original: sa vai svāyaṃbhuvaḥ pūrvaṃ puruṣo manurucyate // / / //
analyzed: sa vai svāyaṃbhuvaḥ pūrvam puruṣaḥ manuḥ ucyate
translated: He, the self-existent one, is called the first Manu.

analyzed: tasya ekasaptati yugam manvantaram iha ucyate
translated: His period of one and seventy Yugas is called a Manvantara here.

analyzed: labdhvā tu puruṣaḥ patnīm śatarūpām ayonijām
translated: Having obtained a wife, Satyarupa, not born from a womb,

original: tayā sa ramate sārddhaṃ tasmātsā ratirucyate /
analyzed: tayā sa ramate sārddham tasmāt sā ratiḥ ucyate
translated: he sports with her, therefore she is called Rati.

analyzed: prathamaḥ saṃprayogaḥ sa kalpa ādau samavarttata
translated: That first union took place at the beginning of the Kalpa.

analyzed: virājam asṛjat brahmā saḥ bhavatpuruṣaḥ virāj
translated: Brahma created Viraj, he became the Purusha Viraj.

original: samrāṭ saśatarūpastu vairājastu manuḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //🔽sa vairājaḥ prajāsargaṃ sasarja puruṣo manuḥ /
analyzed: samrāj sa śatarūpaḥ tu vairājaḥ tu manuḥ smṛtaḥ  sa vairājaḥ prajā sargam sasarja puruṣaḥ manuḥ
translated: Samrat, with Satyarupa, is known as the Manu Vaivasvata.🔽That Manu Vaivasvata, the Purusha, created the creation of beings.

analyzed: vairājāt puruṣāt vīrau śatarūpā vyajāyata
translated: From the Purusha Vaivasvata, Satyarupa gave birth to two heroes,

analyzed: priyavrata uttānapādau putrau putravatām varau
translated: Priyavrata and Uttanapada, the best of those having sons.

original: kanye dve sumahābhāge yābhyāṃ jātā imāḥ prajāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kanye dve su mahābhāge yābhyām jātāḥ imāḥ prajāḥ
translated: He had two daughters, extremely fortunate, from whom these beings were born.

original: devī nāmnā tathākūliḥ prasūtiścaiva te śubhe /
analyzed: devī nāmnā tathā ākūliḥ prasūtiḥ ca eva te śubhe
translated: The goddess by name Akulī and Prasūti, both auspicious.

original: svāyaṃbhuvaḥ prasūtiṃ tu dakṣāya vyasṛjatprabhuḥ // / / //🔽ruceḥ prajāpateścaiva ākūtiṃ pratya pādayat /
analyzed: svāyaṃbhuvaḥ prasūtim tu dakṣāya vyasṛjat prabhuḥ  ruceḥ prajāpateḥ ca eva ākūtim prati pādayat
translated: The self-existent lord created the Prajapatis, and the Prajapatis created the Manus.🔽The Prajapati Ruci begot Akriti.

original: ākūtyāṃ mithunaṃ jajñe mānasasya ruceḥ śubham // / / //
analyzed: ākūtyām mithunam jajñe mānasasya ruceḥ śubham
translated: From Akriti, the mind-born son of Ruci, were born two auspicious twins.

original: yajñaśca dakṣiṇā caiva yamalau tau babhūvatuḥ /
analyzed: yajñaḥ ca dakṣiṇā ca eva yamalau tau babhūvatuḥ
translated: They were Yajna and Dakshina.

original: yajñasya dakṣiṇāyāṃ ca putrā dvādaśa jajñire // / / //
analyzed: yajñasya dakṣiṇāyām ca putrāḥ dvādaśa jajñire
translated: From Yajna and Dakshina were born twelve sons.

analyzed: yāmāḥ iti samākhyātāḥ devāḥ svāyaṃbhuva itare
translated: They are known as the Yamas, the other gods of the Svayambhuva Manu period.

original: yamasya putrā yajñasya tasmādyāmāstu te smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yamasya putrāḥ yajñasya tasmāt yāmāḥ tu te smṛtāḥ
translated: Since they were the sons of Yajna and Dakshina, they are known as Yamas.

original: ajitāścaiva śukrāśca dvau gaṇau brahmaṇaḥ smṛtau /
analyzed: ajitāḥ ca eva śukrāḥ ca dvau gaṇau brahmaṇaḥ smṛtau
translated: Two groups of gods are known as Ajitas and Shukras, the sons of Brahma.

original: yāmāḥ pūrvaṃ parikrāntā yeṣāṃ saṃjñā divaukasaḥ // / / //🔽svāyaṃbhūva sutāyāṃ tu prasūtyāṃ lokamātaraḥ /
analyzed: yāmāḥ pūrvam parikrāntāḥ yeṣām saṃjñā divaukasaḥ  svāyaṃbhūva sutāyām tu prasūtyām loka mātaraḥ
translated: The Yamas were the first to be created, and they are known as the gods of heaven.

analyzed: tasyām kanyāḥ caturviṃśatī dakṣaḥ tu ajanayat prabhuḥ
translated: In the Svayambhuva Manu period, Daksha begot twenty-four daughters, the mothers of the worlds.

analyzed: sarvāḥ tāḥ ca mahābhāgāḥ sarvāḥ kamala locanāḥ
translated: All of them were greatly fortunate, all had eyes like lotus petals,

analyzed: yoga patnyaḥ ca tāḥ sarvāḥ sarvāḥ tāḥ yoga mātaraḥ
translated: all were the wives of the yogis, and all were the mothers of yoga.

analyzed: sarvāḥ ca brahma vādinyaḥ sarvāḥ viśvasya mātaraḥ
translated: All of them were expounders of the Vedas, and all were the mothers of the universe.

analyzed: śraddhā lakṣmīḥ dhṛtiḥ tuṣṭiḥ puṣṭiḥ medhā tathā kriyā
translated: Faith, Lakshmi, Dhriti, Tushti, Pushti, Medha, Kriya,

analyzed: buddhiḥ lajjā vasuḥ śāntiḥ siddhiḥ kīrttiḥ trayodaśa
translated: Buddhi, Lajja, Vasu, Shanti, Siddhi, Kirti, these thirteen,

analyzed: patnī artham pratijagrāha dharmaḥ dākṣāyaṇīḥ prabhuḥ
translated: Dharma, the Lord, accepted as his wives the daughters of Daksha.

analyzed: dvārāṇi etāni ca eva asya vihitāni svayaṃbhuvā
translated: These are the doors ordained by the Self-Existent One.

analyzed: yānyāḥ śiṣṭāḥ yavīyasyaḥ ekādaśa su locanāḥ
translated: The remaining eleven younger ones, of beautiful eyes,

original: satī khyātiśca saṃbhūtiḥ smṛtiḥ prītiḥ kṣamā tathā /
analyzed: satī khyātiḥ ca saṃbhūtiḥ smṛtiḥ prītiḥ kṣamā tathā
translated: SatI, Khyati, Sambhuti, Smriti, Priti, Kshama,

original: sannatiścānasūyā ca ūrjā svāhā svadhā tathā // / / //
analyzed: sannatiḥ ca anasūyā ca ūrjā svāhā svadhā tathā
translated: Sannati, AnasUya, Urja, Svaha, Svadha,

analyzed: tāḥ tadā pratyagṛhṇanta punar anye mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: The great sages accepted them again.

analyzed: rudraḥ bhṛguḥ marīciḥ ca aṅgirāḥ pulahaḥ kratuḥ
translated: Rudra, Bhrigu, Marichi, Angiras, Pulaha, Kratu,

analyzed: tris vasiṣṭhaḥ ca pitaraḥ griḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Pulastya, Atri, Vasishtha, the ancestors, and Agni,

original: satīṃ bhavāya prāyacchatkhyātiṃ ca bhṛgave tathā // / / //🔽marīcaye tu saṃbhūtiṃ smṛtimaṅgirase dadau /
analyzed: satīm bhavāya prāyacchat khyātim ca bhṛgave tathā  marīcaye tu saṃbhūtim smṛtim aṅgirase dadau
translated: He gave SatI to Bhava, Khyati to Bhrigu,🔽And Sambhuti to Marichi, and Smriti to Angiras.

original: prītiṃ caiva pulastyāya kṣamāṃ vai pulahāya ca // / / //
analyzed: prītim ca eva pulastyāya kṣamām vai pulahāya ca
translated: He gave Priti to Pulastya, Kshama to Pulaha,

original: kratave saṃtatiṃ nāma anasūyāṃ tathātraye /🔽ūrjāṃ dadau vasiṣṭhāya svāhāṃ caivāgnaye dadau // / / //
analyzed: kratave saṃtatim nāma anasūyām tathā atraye  ūrjām dadau vasiṣṭhāya svāhām ca eva agnaye dadau
translated: Kratu begot a son named Santa, Atri a son named Anasūyā,🔽Vasiṣṭha a son named Ūrja, and Svāhā a son named Agni.

original: svadhāṃ caiva pitṛbhyastu tāsvapatyāni me śṛṇu /
analyzed: svadhām ca eva pitṛbhyaḥ tu tāsu apatyāni me śṛṇu
translated: Svāhā gave birth to a son named Śvadhā, who became the lord of the Pitṛs. Listen to the names of their sons.

analyzed: etāḥ sarvāḥ mahābhāgāḥ prajāḥ tu anusṛtāḥ sthitāḥ
translated: All these greatly fortunate sons of Dharma are engaged in the creation and sustenance of the world.

analyzed: manvantareṣu sarveṣu yāvat ābhūtasaṃplavam
translated: They continue to exist in all the Manvantaras until the dissolution of all beings.

original: śraddhā kāmaṃ prajajñe 'tha darpo lakṣmī sutaḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śraddhā kāmam prajajñe darpaḥ lakṣmī sutaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Śraddhā gave birth to Kāma, and Lakṣmī to a son named Darpa.

analyzed: dhṛtyāḥ tu niyamaḥ putraḥ tuṣṭyāḥ saṃtoṣaḥ ucyate
translated: Dhṛti had a son named Niyama, and Tuṣṭi a son named Santoṣa.

analyzed: puṣṭyāḥ lābhaḥ sutaḥ ca api medhā putraḥ śrutaḥ tathā
translated: Puṣṭi had a son named Lābha, and Medhā a son named Śruta.

original: kriyāyāstanayau proktau damaśca śama eva ca /
analyzed: kriyāyāḥ tanayau proktau damaḥ ca śamaḥ eva ca
translated: Kriyā had two sons named Dama and Śama, and Buddhi a son named Bodha.

analyzed: buddheḥ bodhaḥ sutaḥ ca api apramādaḥ ca tau ubhau
translated: These two sons of Buddhi were named Apramāda and Prajñā.

original: lajjāyā vinayaḥ putro vyavasāyo vasoḥ sutaḥ /
analyzed: lajjāyāḥ vinayaḥ putraḥ vyavasāyaḥ vasoḥ sutaḥ
translated: Viniyata was the son of Lajjā, and Vyavasāya the son of Vasu.

analyzed: kṣemaḥ śānteḥ sutaḥ ca api sukham siddheḥ vyajāyata
translated: Kṣema was the son of Śānti, and Sukha was born from Siddhi.

analyzed: yaśaḥ kīrteḥ sutaḥ ca api iti ete dharma sūnavaḥ
translated: Yaśas was the son of Kīrti. These are the sons of Dharma.

original: kāmasya tu suto harṣo devyāṃ siddhyāṃ vyajāyata // / / //
analyzed: kāmasya tu sutaḥ harṣaḥ devyām siddhyām vyajāyata
translated: And from Kāma was born Harṣa, the son of the goddess Siddhā.

original: ityeṣa vai sukhodarkaḥ sargo dharmasya sāttvikaḥ /
analyzed: iti eṣa vai sukha udarkaḥ sargaḥ dharmasya sāttvikaḥ
translated: Thus this creation of Dharma, which is characterized by goodness, is indeed the source of happiness.

original: jajñe hiṃsā tvadharmādvai nikṛtiṃ cānṛtaṃ ca te // / / //
analyzed: jajñe hiṃsā tu adharmāt vai nikṛtim ca anṛtam ca te
translated: From Adharma were born Hiṃsā, Nikṛti, and Anṛta.

analyzed: nikṛti anṛtayoḥ jajña bhayam narakaḥ eva ca
translated: From Nikṛti and Anṛta were born Bhaya and Naraka.

analyzed: māyā ca vedanā ca api mithuna dvayam etayoḥ
translated: From these two pairs, Māyā and Vedana were born.

analyzed: mayāt jajñe vai māyā mṛtyum bhūta apahāriṇam
translated: From Māyā was born Māyā, and from her was born Mṛtyu, the destroyer of beings.

original: vedanāyāṃ tataścāpi jejña duḥkhaṃ tu rauravāt // / / //
analyzed: vedanāyām tatas ca api duḥkham tu rauravāt
translated: And from Vedana was born Duḥkha, the hell Raurava.

analyzed: mṛtyoḥ vyādhiḥ jarā śoka krodha asūyāḥ vijajñire
translated: From Mṛtyu were born Vyādhi, Jarā, Śoka, Krodha, and Asūyā.

analyzed: duḥkha uttarāḥ smṛtāḥ hi ete sarve ca adharma lakṣaṇāḥ
translated: All these are said to be characterized by unhappiness and unrighteousness.

original: teṣāṃ bhāryāsti putro vā sarve hyanidhanāḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: teṣām bhāryā asti putraḥ vā sarve hi a nidhanāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: They have no wives or sons, and are all said to be immortal.

original: ityeṣa tāmasaḥ sargo jajñe dharmaniyā makaḥ // / / //
analyzed: iti eṣa tāmasaḥ sargaḥ jajñe makaḥ
translated: Thus this creation of Tamas, which is characterized by Dharma, was born.

analyzed: prajāḥ sṛca iti vyādiṣṭaḥ brahmaṇā nīlalohitaḥ
translated: Nīlalohita was commanded by Brahmā to create beings.

analyzed: saḥ bhidhyāya satīm bhāryām nirmame ca ātma saṃbhavān
translated: He, meditating on his wife Satī, created from himself

analyzed: na adhikān na ca hīnāḥ tān mānasān ātmanā samān
translated: sons who were not superior or inferior to him, but equal to him in mind.

analyzed: sahasram ca sahasrāṇām asṛjat kṛttivāsasaḥ
translated: And created a thousand times a thousand of those clad in skins.

original: tulyānevātmanā sarvān rūpatejobala śrutaiḥ /🔽piṅgalānsaniṣaṅgāṃśca kapardī nīlalohitān // / / //
analyzed: tulyān eva ātmanā sarvān rūpa tejaḥ bala śrutaiḥ  piṅgalān sa niṣaṅgān ca kapardī nīla lohitān
translated: All of them equal to himself in form, splendor, strength, and learning.🔽The tawny ones, the ones with girdles, the matted-haired ones, the blue and red ones,

analyzed: viśikhān hīna keśān ca dṛṣṭi ghnāḥ tān kapālinaḥ
translated: The ones with arrows, the ones with scanty hair, the ones who destroy sight, the skull-bearing ones.

analyzed: mahā rūpān virūpān ca viśva rūpāḥ ca rūpiṇaḥ
translated: The ones with great forms, the misshapen ones, the ones with universal forms, the embodied ones,

analyzed: rathinaḥ varmiṇaḥ ca eva dhanvinaḥ varūthinaḥ
translated: The charioteers, the armored ones, the archers, the ones with shields,

analyzed: sahasra śata bāhūn ca divya bhauma āntarikṣa gān
translated: The ones with hundreds and thousands of arms, the ones who move in the heavens, on the earth, and in the sky,

original: sthūla śīrṣānaṣṭadaṃṣṭrān dvijihvāṃstu trilocanān /🔽annādānpiśitādāṃśca ājyapānsomapostathā // / / //🔽atimeḍhrograkāyāṃśca śitikaṇṭhogramanyukān /
analyzed: sthūla śīrṣān aṣṭa daṃṣṭrān dvi jihvān tu tri locanān  anna ādān piśita ādān ca ājyapān somapoḥ tathā  ati meḍhra ugra kāyān ca śitikaṇṭha ugra manyukān
translated: The ones with large heads, the ones with eight fangs, the ones with double tongues, the three-eyed ones,🔽The ones who eat food, the ones who eat flesh, the ones who drink clarified butter, and the ones who drink soma,🔽The ones with excessively long penises, the ones with fierce bodies, the ones with blue throats, the ones with fierce brows,

analyzed: sa niṣaṅga tanutrān ca dhanvinaḥ hi asi carmiṇaḥ  āsīnān dhāvataḥ ca api jṛṃbhataḥ ca api adhiṣṭhitān
translated: The ones with girdles and armor, the archers, the ones with swords and shields,🔽The seated ones, the running ones, the yawning ones, the standing ones,

analyzed: adhīyānāḥ ca japataḥ yuñjataḥ dhyāyataḥ tathā
translated: The ones who study, the ones who mutter prayers, the ones who practice yoga, the ones who meditate,

analyzed: jvalataḥ varṣataḥ ca eva dyotamānān pradhūpitān
translated: The ones who blaze, the ones who rain, the shining ones, the ones who emit smoke,

analyzed: buddhān buddhatamān ca eva brahmasvān brahma darśinaḥ
translated: The Buddhas, the most excellent among the Buddhas, the Brahmas, the seers of Brahman,

analyzed: nīlagrīvān sahasra akṣān sarvān ca eva kṣamā carān
translated: The blue-throated ones with a thousand eyes, and all those who practice forgiveness,

analyzed: adṛśyān sarva bhūtānām mahā yogān mahā ojasaḥ
translated: The invisible ones among all beings, the great yogis of great prowess,

analyzed: rudataḥ dravataḥ ca eva evam yuktān sahasraśas
translated: The crying ones, the running ones, thus engaged in thousands,

analyzed: ayātayāmān sṛjatam rudram etān sura uttamān
translated: The inexhaustible ones, creating these excellent gods, Rudra,

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā brahmā abravīt enam mā asrākṣīḥ īdṛśīḥ prajāḥ
translated: Seeing this, Brahma said to him, Do not create such beings.

original: na sraṣṭavyātmana stalyā prajā naivādhikā tathā // / / //
analyzed: na sraṣṭavyā ātmanaḥ stalyā prajā nā eva adhikā tathā
translated: Do not create beings that are superior to yourself in strength.

original: anyāḥ sṛjasva bhadraṃ te prajāstvaṃ mṛtyusaṃyutāḥ /
analyzed: anyāḥ sṛjasva bhadram te prajāḥ tvam mṛtyu saṃyutāḥ
translated: Create other beings, blessed one, those that are subject to death.

analyzed: na ārabhante hi karmāṇi prajāḥ vigata mṛtyavaḥ
translated: Beings free from death do not undertake actions.

analyzed: evam uktaḥ bravīt enam na aham mṛtyu jarā anvitāḥ
translated: Thus addressed, he said to him, Blessed one, I will not create beings subject to death and old age.

original: prajāḥ srakṣyāmi bhadraṃ te sthito 'haṃ tvaṃ sṛja prabho // / / //
analyzed: prajāḥ srakṣyāmi bhadram te sthitaḥ ham tvam sṛja prabho
translated: I stand here. You, O Lord, create.

original: ete ye vai mayā sṛṣṭā virūpā nīlalohitāḥ /
analyzed: ete ye vai mayā sṛṣṭāḥ virūpāḥ nīla lohitāḥ
translated: These who have been created by me, the deformed ones, the blue and red ones,

analyzed: sahasram hi sahasrāṇām ātmanaḥ mama niḥsṛtāḥ
translated: A thousand times a thousand of them have issued forth from my own self.

original: ete devā bhaviṣyanti rudrā nāma mahābalāḥ /
analyzed: ete devāḥ bhaviṣyanti rudrāḥ nāma mahā balāḥ
translated: These will be the gods, the mighty Rudras by name.

analyzed: pṛthivyām antarikṣe ca rudrāṇyaḥ tāḥ pariśrutāḥ
translated: On the earth and in the sky, those Rudranis are well-known.

analyzed: śatarudre samāmnātāḥ bhaviṣyanti iha yajñiyāḥ
translated: They will be mentioned in the Shatarudra (mantras) and will be used in sacrifices here.

analyzed: yajña bhājaḥ bhaviṣyanti sarve deva gaṇaiḥ saha
translated: They will share in the sacrifices, along with all the groups of gods.

analyzed: manvantareṣu ye devāḥ bhaviṣyanti iha chanda jāḥ
translated: In the Manvantaras, the gods who will be born from the Vedas here,

analyzed: taiḥ sārddham ijyamānāḥ te sthāsyanti iha ā yuga kṣayāt
translated: will be worshipped along with them, and will remain here until the end of the yuga.

analyzed: evam uktaḥ tatas brahmā mahādevena sa prabhuḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Mahadeva, that lord Brahma,

analyzed: pratyuvāca tathā bhīmam tdṛṣyamāṇaḥ prajāpatiḥ
translated: the Prajapati, seeing Bhima, replied.

original: evaṃ bhavatu bhadraṃ te yathā te vyātdṛtaṃ prabho /
analyzed: evam bhavatu bhadram te yathā te vyātdṛtam prabho
translated: Let it be so, good fortune to you, as you have said, O lord.

analyzed: brahmaṇā samanu jñāte tatas sarvam abhūt kila
translated: When it was approved by Brahma, then everything happened, indeed.

original: tataḥ prabhṛti devaḥ sa na prāsūyata vai prajāḥ /
analyzed: tatas prabhṛti devaḥ sa na prāsūyata vai prajāḥ
translated: From that time onwards, that god did not create beings.

analyzed: ūrdhvaretāḥ sthitaḥ sthāṇuḥ yāvat ābhūtasaṃplavam
translated: With his seed drawn up, he remained steady, like a pillar, until the end of the world.

analyzed: yasmāt proktam sthitaḥ smi iti tasmāt sthāṇuḥ budhaiḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Because he said, I remain, therefore he is remembered as Sthanu by the wise.

original: jñānaṃ tapaśca satyaṃ ca hyaiśvaryaṃ dharma eva ca // / / //
analyzed: jñānam tapaḥ ca satyam ca hi aiśvaryam dharmaḥ eva ca
translated: Knowledge, austerity, truth, power, and righteousness,

analyzed: vairāgyam ātma saṃbodhaḥ kṛtsnāni etāni śaṅkare
translated: Renunciation, self-realization, and all these are in Śaṅkara.

analyzed: sarvān devān ṛṣīn ca eva sametān asuraiḥ saha
translated: Surpassing all the gods, sages, and these demons together...

analyzed: atyeti tejasā devaḥ mahādevaḥ tatas smṛtaḥ
translated: The god who surpasses with his splendor is called Mahādeva.

analyzed: atyeti devāḥ na aiśvaryāt valena ca mahā asurān
translated: Surpassing the gods in lordship and the great demons in strength...

analyzed: jñānena ca munīn sarvān yogāt bhūtāni sarvaśas
translated: And surpassing all the sages in knowledge and all beings in yoga...

analyzed: evam eva mahādevaḥ sarva deva namaskṛtaḥ
translated: Thus Mahādeva, revered by all the gods,

analyzed: prajām anu dyāmām sṛṣṭvā sargāt upararāma ha
translated: Having created the progeny and the worlds, ceased from creation...

original: iti śrī brahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyuprokte pūrvabhāge dvitīye 'nuṣaṅgapāde rudraprasavavarṇanaṃ nāma navamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī brahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyu prokte pūrva bhāge dvitīye nuṣaṅga pāde rudraprasavavarṇanam nāma navamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the ninth chapter, describing the birth of Rudra, in the second book, called The Continuation, of the Great Indian Epic, the Brahmanda Purana, narrated by the sage Vāyu.

analyzed: ṛṣiḥ uvāca
translated: The sage said:

analyzed: asmin kalpe tvayā na uktaḥ prādurbhāvaḥ mahātmanaḥ
translated: In this kalpa, you have not mentioned the manifestation of the great soul,

analyzed: mahādevasya rudrasya sādhakaiḥ ṛṣibhiḥ saha
translated: of Mahādeva Rudra, along with the sages who are his devotees...

analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Sūta said:

analyzed: utpattiḥ ādisargasya mayā proktā samāsatas
translated: I have described the origin of the primordial creation in brief.

analyzed: vistareṇa pravakṣyāmi nāmāni tanubhiḥ saha
translated: I will now describe the names along with the forms in detail...

analyzed: patnīṣu janayāmāsa mahādevaḥ sutān bahūn
translated: Mahādeva begot many sons on his wives.

original: kalpeṣvanyeṣvatīteṣu hyasminkalpe tu tāñśṛṇu // / / //🔽kalpādāvātmanastulyaṃ sutamadhyāyata prabhuḥ /
analyzed: kalpeṣu anyeṣu atīteṣu hi asmin kalpe tu tān śṛṇu  kalpa ādau ātmanaḥ tulyam sutam adhyāyata prabhuḥ
translated: In other Kalpas, listen to them in this Kalpa.🔽At the beginning of the Kalpa, the Lord created a son equal to himself.

translated: Sannati gave birth to auspicious sons equal to Kratu in the sacrifice.
