original: agnirhyahaṃ somayutaḥ somaścāgnimupaśritaḥ // / / //🔽kṛtākṛtaṃ vadantyagniṃ bhūyo lokāḥ samāśritāḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ hi aham soma yutaḥ somaḥ ca agnim upaśritaḥ  kṛta akṛtam vadanti agnim bhūyas lokāḥ samāśritāḥ
translated: I am Agni, united with Soma, and Soma is dependent on Agni.🔽People call Agni the doer and the undoer, and the worlds are again dependent on him.

analyzed: asakṛt ca agninā dagdham jagat sthāvara jaṅgamam
translated: The world with its moving and unmoving beings is repeatedly burned by Agni.

analyzed: bhasma sādhyam hi tat sarvam pavitram idam uttamam
translated: Everything is reduced to ashes, and this is the best purifier.

analyzed: bhasmanā vīryam āsthāya bhūtāni pariṣiñcati
translated: Relying on the power of ashes, he sprinkles the beings.

original: agnikāryaṃ ca yatkṛtvā kariṣyati ca tryāyuṣam /
analyzed: agni kāryam ca yat kṛtvā kariṣyati ca tri āyuṣam
translated: Having performed the fire ritual, he will do the three-life ritual.

analyzed: bhasmanā mama vīryeṇa mucyate sarva kilbiṣaiḥ
translated: By my semen, one is freed from all sins.

original: bhāsayatyeva yadbhasma śubhaṃ vāsayate ca yat /
analyzed: bhāsayati eva yat bhasma śubham vāsayate ca yat
translated: The ash that shines and makes auspicious,

analyzed: tad kṣaṇāt sarva pāpānām bhasma iti parikīrtyate
translated: is declared as ash for all sins instantly.

original: ūṣmapāḥ pitaro jñeyā devā vai somasaṃbhavāḥ /
analyzed: ūṣmapāḥ pitaraḥ jñeyāḥ devāḥ vai soma saṃbhavāḥ
translated: The ancestors are to be known as the drinkers of heat, the gods are born from the moon.

analyzed: agnīṣoma ātmakam sarvam jagat sthāvara jam gamam
translated: The entire world of moving and unmoving beings is of the nature of Agni and Soma.

analyzed: aham agniḥ mahā tejāḥ somaḥ ca eṣā mama aṃbikā
translated: I am the greatly radiant fire, and this is my mother Ambika, the moon.

analyzed: aham agniḥ ca somaḥ ca prakṛtyā puruṣaḥ svayam
translated: I am myself the fire and the moon, the primordial Purusha.

analyzed: tasmāt bhasma mahābhāgāḥ mad vīryam iti ca ucyate
translated: Therefore, the ash is said to be my semen, O blessed ones.

original: svavīryaṃ vapuṣā caiva dhārayāmīti vai sthitiḥ // / / //
analyzed: sva vīryam vapuṣā ca eva dhārayāmi iti vai sthitiḥ
translated: The state is that I bear my own semen with my body.

analyzed: tadā prabhṛti lokeṣu rakṣā artham aśubheṣu ca
translated: From that time onwards, for the protection of the worlds and the inauspicious,

original: bhasmanā kriyate rakṣā sūtikānāṃ gṛheṣu ca // / / //
analyzed: bhasmanā kriyate rakṣā sūtikānām gṛheṣu ca
translated: protection is done with ash in the houses of women in childbirth.

analyzed: bhasma snāna viśuddha ātmā jita krodhaḥ jita indriyaḥ
translated: One whose soul is purified by the ash bath, who has conquered anger and controlled the senses,

analyzed: mad samīpa su upāgamya na bhūyas vinivartate
translated: having come near me, does not return again.

analyzed: vratam pāśupatam yogam kāpālam yoga nirmitam
translated: The Pasupata vow, the Kapala yoga created by yoga,

analyzed: pūrvam pāśupatam hi etat nirmitam tat anuttamam
translated: This is the Pāśupata vow, created first by Śiva, the supreme one.

analyzed: śeṣāḥ ca āśramiṇaḥ sarve paścāt sṛṣṭāḥ svayaṃbhuvā
translated: The other stages of life were created later by the Self-Existent One.

analyzed: sṛṣṭiḥ eṣā mayā sṛṣṭā lajjā moha bhaya ātmikā
translated: This creation of mine is characterized by shame, delusion, and fear.

original: nagnā eva hi jāyante devatā munayastathā /
analyzed: nagnāḥ eva hi jāyante devatāḥ munayaḥ tathā
translated: The gods and sages are born naked.

analyzed: ye ca anye mānavāḥ loke sarve jāyanti avāsasaḥ
translated: And all other humans in the world are born without clothes.

analyzed: indriyaiḥ ajitaiḥ nagnāḥ dukūlena api saṃvṛtāḥ
translated: Those who are not restrained by the senses are naked, even if covered by silk.

original: taireva saṃvṛto guptona vastraṃ kāraṇaṃ smṛtam // / / //
analyzed: taiḥ eva saṃvṛtaḥ vastram kāraṇam smṛtam
translated: Covered by those very senses, one is protected; clothes are not remembered as the cause.

original: kṣamā dhṛtirahiṃsā ca vairāgyaṃ caiva sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: kṣamā dhṛtiḥ ahiṃsā ca vairāgyam ca eva sarvaśas
translated: Forgiveness, patience, non-violence, and detachment in every way,

analyzed: tulyau māna apamānau ca tat prāvaraṇam uttamam
translated: and regarding honor and dishonor as equal - that is the best covering.

analyzed: bhasma pāṇḍura digdha aṅgaḥ dhyāyate manasā bhavam
translated: With his body smeared with ash-white paste, he meditates on Bhava with his mind.

analyzed: yadi akārya sahasrāṇi kṛtvā snāyati bhasmanā
translated: If one bathes in ash after committing thousands of misdeeds,

analyzed: tat sarvam dahate bhasma yathā agniḥ tejasā vanam
translated: that ash burns them all, just as fire burns a forest with its flames.

original: tasmā dyatnaparo bhūtvā trikālamapi yaḥ sadā // / / //
analyzed: tasmai dyatna paraḥ bhūtvā tri kālam api yaḥ sadā
translated: Therefore, one who strives with effort and always bathes three times a day

original: bhasmanā kurute snānaṃ gāṇapatyaṃ sa gacchati /
analyzed: bhasmanā kurute snānam gāṇapatyam sa gacchati
translated: with ash, attains the state of Gaṇeśa.

analyzed: saṃhṛtya ca kratūn sarvān gṛhītvā amṛtam uttamam
translated: And having withdrawn all the sacrifices, and taken the excellent nectar,

analyzed: dhyāyanti ye mahādevam līnāḥ tad bhāva bhāvitāḥ
translated: Those who meditate on Mahadeva, absorbed in him, their thoughts fixed on him,

analyzed: uttareṇa atha panthānam te mṛta tvam avāpnuyuḥ
translated: They will attain immortality by the northern path.

original: dakṣiṇenātha panthānaṃ ye śmaśānāni bhejire /🔽aṇimā mahimā caiva laghimā prāptireva ca // / / //🔽garimā pañcamī caiva ṣaṣṭhaṃ prākāmyameva ca /
analyzed: dakṣiṇena atha panthānam ye śmaśānāni bhejire  aṇimā mahimā ca eva laghimā prāptiḥ eva ca  garimā pañcamī ca eva ṣaṣṭham prākāmyam eva ca
translated: Those who have resorted to cremation grounds by the southern path,🔽They have attained the five powers of becoming atomic, becoming large, lightness, omnipresence, and heaviness,🔽And the sixth power of omnipotence,

original: īśitvaṃ ca vaśitvaṃ ca hyamaratvaṃ ca te gatāḥ // / / //
analyzed: īśitvam ca vaśitvam ca hi amara tvam ca te gatāḥ
translated: And immortality.

analyzed: indra ādayaḥ tathā devāḥ kāmikam vratam āsthitāḥ
translated: The gods Indra and others, having undertaken the vow of fulfilling desires,

analyzed: aiśvaryam paramam prāpya sarve prathita tejasaḥ
translated: Having attained supreme lordship, all of them of renowned brilliance,

analyzed: vyapagata mada moha mukta rāgāḥ tamerahaja doṣa vivarjita svabhāvāḥ
translated: Free from pride, delusion, and attachment, their nature free from the faults of the sun, moon, and Rahu,

analyzed: paribhavam idam uttamam viditvā paśupati dayitam idam vratam caradhvam
translated: Having known this excellent humiliation, practice this beloved vow of Pashupati.

analyzed: yaḥ paṭhet vai śuciḥ bhūtvā śraddadhānaḥ jita indriyaḥ
translated: One who recites this, being pure, faithful, and self-controlled,

analyzed: sarva pāpa viśuddha ātmā rudra lokam sa gacchati
translated: With his soul purified from all sins, he goes to Rudra's world.

original: iti śrībrahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyuprokte pūrvabhāge dvitīye 'nuṣaṅgapāda dāruvanapraveśabhasmasnānavidhirnāma saptaviṃśatitamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī brahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyuprokte pūrva bhāge dvitīye nuṣaṅga pāda dāruvanapraveśabhasmasnānavidhiḥ nāma saptaviṃśatitamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Twenty-seventh Chapter, in the First Book, of the Srimad-Brahmanda Purana, called the Vayu-Samhita, dealing with the entry into the forest of Dāruvana and the rules for the ash bath.

analyzed: ṛṣiḥ uvāca
translated: The sage said:

analyzed: agāt katham amāvasyām māsi māsi divam nṛpaḥ
translated: How did the king go to heaven every month on the new moon day?

analyzed: ailaḥ purūravāḥ sūta katham vā atarpayat pitṝn
translated: O Suta, how did Ila Pururava satisfy his ancestors?

analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

analyzed: tasya te ham pravakṣyāmi prabhāvam śāṃśapāyane
translated: I will tell you about the power of Shaṃshāyana,

analyzed: ailasya āditya saṃyogam somasya ca mahātmanaḥ
translated: The union of Ila with the sun and the great-souled moon.

analyzed: antaḥsāra mayasya indoḥ pakṣayoḥ śukla kṛṣṇayoḥ
translated: Of the moon, which is full of essence, in the two fortnights, bright and dark,

original: hrāsavṛddhī pidṛmataḥ pitryasya ca vinirṇayam // / / //🔽somāccaivāmṛtaprāptiṃ pitṝṇāṃ tarvaṇaṃ tathā /
analyzed: hrāsa vṛddhī pidṛmataḥ pitryasya ca vinirṇayam  somāt ca eva amṛta prāptim pitṝṇām tarvaṇam tathā
translated: The decrease and increase, the determination of the ancestors,🔽And the attainment of nectar from the moon, and the worship of the ancestors,

analyzed: kāvya agniṣvātta maumyānām pitṝṇām ca eva darśanam
translated: And the vision of the ancestors, the fire of poetry, and the fire of the ancestors.

analyzed: yathā purūravāḥ ca eva tarpayāmāsa vai pitṝn
translated: How Pururava satisfied the ancestors,

analyzed: etat sarvam pravakṣyāmi parvāṇi ca yathākramam
translated: I will tell all this, and the parvas in order.

original: yadā tu candrasūryauṃ vai nakṣatreṇa samāgatau /
analyzed: yadā tu candra sūryaum vai nakṣatreṇa samāgatau
translated: When the moon and sun are together with the stars,

analyzed: amāvasyām nivasataḥ eka rātra eka maṇḍalau
translated: He lives on the new moon day, one night and one mandala.

analyzed: sa gacchati tadā draṣṭum divākara niśākarau
translated: Then he goes to see the sun and the moon.

analyzed: amāvasyām amāvāsyām mātāmaha pitāmahau
translated: On the new moon day, he worships his maternal and paternal grandfathers.

original: abhivādya sa tau tatra kālāpekṣaḥ pratīkṣate /
analyzed: abhivādya sa tau tatra kāla apekṣaḥ pratīkṣate
translated: Having greeted them there, he waits, expecting the right time.

analyzed: prasyandamānāt somāt tu pitṛ artham tu pariśravān
translated: From the flowing Soma, for the sake of the ancestors, he collects the remnants.

analyzed: ailaḥ purūravāḥ vidvān māsa śrāddha cikīrṣayā
translated: The learned Aila Pururava, desiring to perform the monthly Shraddha,

original: upāste pitṛmantaṃ taṃ somaṃ divi samāsthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: upāste pitṛmantam tam somam divi samāsthitaḥ
translated: worships that Soma, attended by the ancestors, stationed in the sky.

original: dvilavāṃ kuhūmātrāṃ ca te ubhe tu vicārya saḥ /🔽sinīvālīpramāṇebhyaḥ sinīvālīmupāsya saḥ // / / //
analyzed: dvi lavām kuhū mātrām ca te ubhe tu vicārya saḥ  sinīvālī pramāṇebhyaḥ sinīvālīm upāsya saḥ
translated: Considering both the two-part and the one-part Kuhu,🔽having worshipped Kuhu, which is equal to the measure of Sinivali,

original: kuhūmātraḥ kalāṃ caiva jñātvopāste kuhūṃ tathā /
analyzed: kuhū mātraḥ kalām ca eva jñātvā upāste kuhūm tathā
translated: knowing the one-part Kuhu, he worships Kuhu likewise.

analyzed: sa tadā tām upāsīnaḥ kāla apekṣaḥ prapaśyati
translated: Sitting there, he waits, expecting the right time, and sees

analyzed: sudhā amṛtam tu tat somāt sravat vai māsa tṛptaye
translated: the nectar flowing from Soma, for the satisfaction of a month.

analyzed: daśabhiḥ pañcabhiḥ ca eva sudhā amṛta parisravaiḥ
translated: By the ten and five streams of nectar and ambrosia,

analyzed: kṛṣṇa pakṣe bhujām prītyā dahyamānām tathā aṃśubhiḥ
translated: in the dark fortnight, he delights the Bhuh with the rays that burn.

original: sadyaḥ prakṣaratā tena saumyena madhunā tu saḥ // / / //🔽nirvāteṣtratha pakṣeṣu pitryeṇa vidhinā divi /
analyzed: sadyas prakṣaratā tena saumyena madhunā tu saḥ  pakṣeṣu pitryeṇa vidhinā divi
translated: And with that sweet honey flowing forth immediately,🔽In the windless months, in the paternal rites, in the sky,

analyzed: sudhā amṛtena rājā aindraḥ tarpa yāmāsa vai pitṝn
translated: The king offered libations to the ancestors with the nectar of immortality.

analyzed: saumyān barhiṣadaḥ kāvyān agniṣvāttān tathā eva ca
translated: The gentle ones seated on the sacrificial grass, the descendants of Kavya, and likewise the descendants of Agni,

original: ṛtamagnistu yaḥ proktaḥ sa tu saṃvatsaro mataḥ // / / //🔽jajñire hyṛtavastasmāddhyṛtubhyaścārttavāstathā /🔽ārtavā hyarddhamāsākhyāḥ pitaro hyṛtusūnavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ṛtam agniḥ tu yaḥ proktaḥ sa tu saṃvatsaraḥ mataḥ  jajñire hi ṛtavaḥ tasmāt hi ṛtubhyaḥ ca ārttavāḥ tathā  ārtavāḥ hi arddha māsa ākhyāḥ pitaraḥ hi ṛtu sūnavaḥ
translated: The truth is said to be Agni, and he is considered to be the year.🔽From him were born the seasons, and from the seasons, the half-months.🔽The half-months known as the lunar fortnights are the sons of the seasons, the ancestors.

analyzed: ṛtavaḥ pitāmahāḥ māsāḥ ayana ahi abda sūnavaḥ
translated: The seasons are the grandfathers, the months are the sons of the year.

original: prapitāmahāstu vai devāḥ pañcābdā brahmaṇaḥ sutāḥ // / / //
analyzed: prapitāmahāḥ tu vai devāḥ pañca abdāḥ brahmaṇaḥ sutāḥ
translated: The great-grandfathers are the gods, the five-year-old sons of Brahman.

original: saumyāstu somajā jñeyāḥ kāvyā jñeyāḥ kaveḥ sutāḥ /
analyzed: saumyāḥ tu soma jāḥ jñeyāḥ kāvyāḥ jñeyāḥ kaveḥ sutāḥ
translated: The gentle ones should be known as born from Soma, and the descendants of Kavya should be known as the sons of Kavya.

original: upahūtāḥ smṛtā devāḥ somajāḥ somapāḥ smṛtāḥ // / / //🔽ājyapāstu smṛtāḥ kāvyāstisrastāḥ pitṛjātayaḥ /
analyzed: upahūtāḥ smṛtāḥ devāḥ soma jāḥ somapāḥ smṛtāḥ  ājyapāḥ tu smṛtāḥ kāvyāḥ tisraḥ tāḥ pitṛ jātayaḥ
translated: The gods are remembered as invoked, and the descendants of Soma are remembered as drinkers of Soma.🔽The descendants of Kavya are remembered as drinkers of clarified butter, and these three are the classes of ancestors.

analyzed: kāvyāḥ barhiṣadaḥ ca eva agniṣvāttāḥ ca tāḥ tridhā
translated: The descendants of Kavya are threefold: those seated on the sacrificial grass, and those descended from Agni.

original: gṛhasthā ye ca yajvāna ṛturbarhiṣado dhruvam /
analyzed: gṛhasthāḥ ye ca yajvānaḥ ṛtuḥ barhiṣadaḥ dhruvam
translated: Those householders who perform sacrifices are certainly the sacrificial grass-seated ones in the seasons.

analyzed: gṛhasthāḥ ca api ayajvāna agniṣvāttāḥ tathā ārttavāḥ
translated: And householders who do not perform sacrifices, and those who offer oblations into the fire, and those who are in distress,

analyzed: aṣṭakā patayaḥ kāvyāḥ pañca abdāḥ tān nibodhata
translated: The lords of the Ashtakas, the Kavyas, and the five years, know them.

analyzed: teṣām saṃvatsaraḥ hi agniḥ sūyaḥ tu parivatsaraḥ
translated: Their year is indeed fire, the Suyu is the parivatsara,

analyzed: somaḥ iṣ vatsaraḥ proktaḥ vāyuḥ ca eva anuvatsaraḥ
translated: Soma is said to be the Idvatsara, and Vayu is the anuvatsara.

analyzed: rudraḥ tu vatsaraḥ teṣām pañca abdāḥ te yuga ātmakāḥ
translated: Rudra is their vatsara, those five years are of the nature of a yuga.

analyzed: kāvyāḥ ca eva ūṣmapāḥ ca eva divākīrtyāḥ ca te smṛtāḥ
translated: They are also called Kavya, Ushmapas, and Divakirtyas.

original: ye te pibantyamāvasyāṃ māsimāsi sudhāṃ divi // / / //
analyzed: ye te pibanti amāvasyām māsi māsi sudhām divi
translated: Those who drink the nectar in the new moon every month in heaven,

analyzed: tān tena tarpayāmāsa yāvat āsīt purūravāḥ
translated: He satisfied them with that as long as Pururava existed.

analyzed: yasmāt prasravate somāt māsi māsi dhinoti ca
translated: From whom the Soma flows, and who delights every month,

analyzed: tasmāt sudhā amṛtam tat vai pitṝṇām soma pāyinām
translated: Therefore that nectar is indeed the nectar of the ancestors who drink Soma.

original: evaṃ tadamṛtaṃ saumyaṃ sudhā ca madu caiva ha // / / //
analyzed: evam tat amṛtam saumyam sudhā ca madu ca eva ha
translated: Thus that nectar is indeed the nectar of Soma, and also the nectar of the moon,

original: kṛṣṇapakṣe yathā vendoḥ kalāḥ pañcadaśa kramāt /
analyzed: kṛṣṇa pakṣe yathā vā indoḥ kalāḥ pañcadaśa kramāt
translated: Just as the fifteen digits of the moon in the dark fortnight in order,

analyzed: pibanti aṃbu mayam devāḥ trayastriṃśat tu chandanāḥ
translated: The thirty-three gods drink the water-born nectar,

analyzed: pītvā arddha māsam gacchanti caturdaśyām sudhā amṛtam
translated: Having drunk the nectar for half a month, they go on the fourteenth.

analyzed: iti evam pīyamānaiḥ tu devaiḥ sarvaiḥ niśākaraḥ
translated: Thus, the Moon is drunk by all the gods in this way.

analyzed: samāgacchati amāvasyām bhāge pañcadaśe sthitaḥ
translated: It arrives at the new moon, remaining in the fifteenth part.

analyzed: suṣumṇā āpyāyitam ca eva hi amāvasyām yathā kramam
translated: And the new moon is nourished by Suṣumnā, in due order.

analyzed: pibanti dvi lavam kālam pitaraḥ te sudhā amṛtam
translated: The ancestors drink the nectar of ambrosia for two-and-a-half lava periods.

analyzed: pīta kṣayam tatas somam sūryo sau eka raśminā  āpyāyayat suṣumṇātaḥ punar tān soma pāyinaḥ
translated: Then the Sun, with a single ray, causes the waning Soma to be drunk.🔽It nourishes again those who drink Soma from Suṣumnā.

original: niḥ śeṣāyāṃ kalāyāṃ tu somamāpyāyayatpunaḥ // / / //🔽suṣumṇāpyāyamānasya bhāgaṃ bhāgamahaḥ kramāt /
analyzed: niḥ śeṣāyām kalāyām tu somam āpyāyayat punar  suṣumṇā āpyāyamānasya bhāgam bhāgam ahar kramāt
translated: When the lunar day is completely exhausted, it nourishes Soma again.🔽The lunar days, which are black, gradually diminish the part by part nourishment of Suṣumnā.

original: kalāḥ kṣīyanti tāḥ kṛṣṇāḥ śuklā cāpyāyayanti tam // / / //
analyzed: kalāḥ kṣīyanti tāḥ kṛṣṇāḥ śuklā ca āpyāyayanti tam
translated: The white ones nourish it again.

analyzed: evam sūryasya vīryeṇa candrasya āpyāyitā tanuḥ
translated: Thus, the body of the Moon is nourished by the energy of the Sun.

original: dṛśyate paurṇamāsyāṃ vai śuklaḥ saṃpūrṇamaṇḍalaḥ // / / //🔽saṃsiddhirevaṃ somasya pakṣayoḥ śuklakṛṣṇayoḥ /
analyzed: dṛśyate paurṇamāsyām vai śuklaḥ saṃpūrṇa maṇḍalaḥ  saṃsiddhiḥ evam somasya pakṣayoḥ śukla kṛṣṇayoḥ
translated: It is seen on the full moon day, white and with a full orb.🔽Thus, the Moon is perfected in the two fortnights, the bright and the dark.

analyzed: iti evam pitṛmān somaḥ smṛtaḥ iṣ vatsara ātmakaḥ
translated: Thus, Soma, along with the ancestors, is remembered as having the nature of the year.

analyzed: krāntaḥ pañcadaśaiḥ sārddham sudhā amṛta parisravaiḥ
translated: It is traversed along with the fifteen, which flow with nectar and ambrosia.

original: ataḥ parvāṇi vakṣyāmi varvaṇāṃ saṃdhayaśca ye // / / //
analyzed: atas parvāṇi vakṣyāmi varvaṇām saṃdhayaḥ ca ye
translated: Therefore, I will describe the Parvas and the Sandhis (junctions) of the Varvas (half-months).

original: granthimanti yathā parvāṇīkṣuve ṇvorbhavantyuta /🔽tathārddhamāsi parvāṇi śuklakṛṣṇāni caiva hi // / / //
analyzed: granthimanti yathā parvāṇi ikṣuve ṇvoḥ bhavanti uta  tathā arddha māsi parvāṇi śukla kṛṣṇāni ca eva hi
translated: Just as the Parvas (junctions) of the sugarcane stalk are knotted,🔽so are the Parvas of the bright and dark fortnights.

analyzed: pūrṇa amāvasyayoḥ bhedau granthayaḥ saṃdhayaḥ ca vai
translated: The differences between the full moon and new moon days are the knots and junctions.

analyzed: arddha māsam tu parvāṇi dvitīyā prabhṛtīni tu
translated: But the Parvas (junctions) of the half-month begin from the second day.

analyzed: anvādhāna kriyā yasmāt kriyate parvasaṃdhiṣu
translated: Since the Anvādhāna rite is performed at the Parva junctions,

original: tasmāttu parvaṇāmādau pratipatsarvasaṃdhiṣu // / / //🔽sāyāhne 'hyanumatyādau kālo dvilava ucyate /
analyzed: tasmāt tu parvaṇām ādau pratipad sarva saṃdhiṣu  sāyāhne hi anumati ādau kālaḥ dvi lavaḥ ucyate
translated: therefore, at the beginning of the Parvas, on the Pratipat (first day) and all the junctions,🔽in the evening, at the beginning of Anumati, a period of two Lava is said.

original: lavau dvāveva rākāyāṃ kālo jñeyo 'parāhṇakaḥ // / / //🔽pratipatkṛṣṇapakṣasya kāle 'tīte 'parāhṇake /
analyzed: lavau dvau eva rākāyām kālaḥ parāhṇakaḥ  pratipad kṛṣṇapakṣasya kāle tīte parāhṇake
translated: Two Lava only in the Rākā (night), the period should be known as afternoon.🔽When the afternoon time of the first day of the dark fortnight has passed,

original: sāyāhne pratipanne ca sa kālaḥ paurṇamāsikaḥ // / / //🔽vyatīpāte sthite sūrye lekhārddhe tu yugāntare /
analyzed: sāyāhne pratipanne ca sa kālaḥ paurṇamāsikaḥ  vyatīpāte sthite sūrye lekha arddhe tu yuga antare
translated: and the evening has set in, that is the time of the full moon.🔽When the sun is in Vyatīpāta, in the middle of the half-sign,

analyzed: yuga antara udite ca eva leśa arddhe śaśinaḥ kramāt
translated: and when the half-sign has risen, the period of the moon is in order.

analyzed: paurṇamāsī vyatīpāte yat īkṣetām parasparam
translated: If the full moon and Vyatīpāta were to look at each other,

original: yasminkāle samau syātāṃ tau vyatīpāta eva saḥ // / / //
analyzed: yasmin kāle samau syātām tau vyatīpātaḥ eva saḥ
translated: When the two are equal, that is indeed a vyatīpāta.

original: taṃ kālaṃ sūryanirddeśyaṃ dṛṣṭvā saṃkhyāṃ tu sarpati /
analyzed: tam kālam sūrya nirddeśyam dṛṣṭvā saṃkhyām tu sarpati
translated: Having seen that time indicated by the sun, the number moves.

original: sa vai vaṣaṭākriyākālaḥ sadyaḥ kālaṃ vidhīyate // / / //
analyzed: sa vai vaṣaṭā kriyā kālaḥ sadyas kālam vidhīyate
translated: That is the time of the utterance of vasaṭ, it is prescribed as the immediate time.

analyzed: pūrṇandoḥ pūrṇapakṣe tu rātrisaṃdhiḥ ca pūrṇimā
translated: In the full moon of the bright fortnight, the conjunction of night is the full moon.

original: tato virajyate naktaṃ paurṇamāsyāṃ niśākaraḥ // / / //🔽yadīkṣete vyatīpāte divā pūrṇe parasparam /
analyzed: tatas virajyate naktam paurṇamāsyām niśākaraḥ  yat īkṣete vyatīpāte divā pūrṇe parasparam
translated: Then the moon withdraws from the night on the full moon day.🔽If the moon and the sun are seen mutually in the daytime in a vyatīpāta,

analyzed: candra arkau aparāhṇe tu pūrṇa ātmānau tu pūrṇimā
translated: then the full moon is the full moon with the full self at midday.

analyzed: yasmāt tām anumanyante pitaraḥ daivataiḥ saha
translated: Since the ancestors along with the gods approve of it,

original: tasmādanumatirnāma pūrṇimā prathamā smṛtā // / / //🔽atyarthaṃ bhrājate yasmādvyomnyasyāṃ vai niśākaraḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt anumatiḥ nāma pūrṇimā prathamā smṛtā  atyartham bhrājate yasmāt vyomni asyām vai niśākaraḥ
translated: therefore the first full moon is known as Anumati.🔽Since the moon shines excessively in the sky on this day,

analyzed: rañjanāt ca eva candrasya rākā iti kavayaḥ bruvan
translated: and because it delights the moon, the wise ones call it Rākā.

analyzed: amāvasetām ṛkṣe tu yadā candra divākarau
translated: When the moon and the sun are in the lunar mansion of Amāvasā,

analyzed: rākā pañcadaśī rātriḥ amāvāsyā tatas smṛtā
translated: the fifteenth night is called Rākā, and the new moon day is remembered as Amāvāsyā.

analyzed: vyucchidya tam amāvasyām paśyataḥ tau samāgatau
translated: Seeing the two come together on the new moon day, having interrupted the darkness,

original: anyonyaṃ candrasūryauṃ tau yadā tadvarśa ucyate // / / //
analyzed: anyonyam candra sūryaum tau yadā tat varśaḥ ucyate
translated: And when those two, the moon and the sun, are mutually eclipsed, that is said to be a year.

original: dvau dvau lavāvamāvāsyā sa kālaḥ parvasaṃdhiṣu /
analyzed: dvau dvau lavau amāvāsyā sa kālaḥ parvasaṃdhiṣu
translated: Two lavas (a period of 72 minutes) before and after the new moon is the time of the parva sandhis (parva conjunctions).

analyzed: dvyakṣara kuhumātraḥ ca parvakālāḥ trayaḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The three parva times are said to be two aksharas (letters) and one kuhus (a period of 48 minutes).

analyzed: naṣṭa candrā tu amāvasyā yā madhya aṅnāt pravarttate
translated: The new moon that occurs after the moon has set is called nishchachandra (moonless).

original: divasārddhena rātryā ca sūryaṃ prāpya tu candramāḥ // / / //
analyzed: divasa arddhena rātryā ca sūryam prāpya tu candramāḥ
translated: The moon, having reached the sun in half a day and half a night,

original: sūryeṇa saha sāmudraṃ gatvā prātastanātsa vai /
analyzed: sūryeṇa saha sāmudram gatvā prātastanāt sa vai
translated: goes with the sun to the ocean in the morning.🔽The sun, at the two times of conjunction and midday, is always

original: dvau kālau saṃgamaṃ caiva madhyāhne niyataṃ raviḥ // / / //
analyzed: dvau kālau saṃgamam ca eva madhyāhne niyatam raviḥ
translated: in the middle of the two mandalas.

original: pratipacchuklapakṣasya candramāḥ sūrya maṇḍalāt /🔽vimucyamānayormadhye tayormaṇḍalayostu vai // / / //
analyzed: pratipad śuklapakṣasya candramāḥ sūrya maṇḍalāt  vimucyamānayoḥ madhye tayoḥ maṇḍalayoḥ tu vai
translated: The new moon of the bright fortnight is when the moon is released from the solar disc.

original: sa tadā hyāhuteḥ kālo darśasya tu vaṣaṭkriyā /
analyzed: sa tadā hi āhuteḥ kālaḥ darśasya tu vaṣaṭkriyā
translated: The time of the darsha (new moon) sacrifice is when the moon is released from the sun's disc.

analyzed: etat ṛtu mukham jñeyam amāḥ vā asya asya parvaṇaḥ
translated: This is known as the beginning of the season, the parva of the new moon.

original: divāparva hyamāvāsyā kṣīṇendau bahule tu vai /
analyzed: divāparva hi amāvāsyā kṣīṇa indau bahule tu vai
translated: The new moon is the daytime parva when the moon is waning, and the full moon is the daytime parva when the moon is waxing.

analyzed: tasmāt divā hi amāvāsyām gṛhyate sau divākaraḥ
translated: Therefore, the sun is taken to be at the daytime new moon.

original: gṛhyate tu divā tasmādamāvāsyāṃ divi kṣayām /🔽kalānāmapi caitāsāṃ vṛddhihānyā jalātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: gṛhyate tu divā tasmāt amāvāsyām divi kṣayām  kalānām api ca etāsām vṛddhi hānyā jala ātmanaḥ
translated: But it is perceived during the day, therefore the new moon is in the sky during the day.🔽And by the increase and decrease of the water-like digits of these,

analyzed: tithīnām nāmadheyāni vidvadbhiḥ saṃjñitāni vai
translated: The names of the lunar days are designated by the learned.

analyzed: darśayetām atha ātmānam sūryācandramasau ubhau
translated: Then the sun and the moon show themselves,

analyzed: niṣkrāmati atha tena eva kramaśas sūrya maṇḍalāt
translated: Then the moon gradually emerges from the solar disc.

analyzed: dvi lava ūnam ahorātram bhāskaram spṛśate śaśī
translated: The day and night are two lava units, the moon touches the sun,

original: sa tadā hyāhuteḥ kālodarśasya tu vaṣaṭkriyā /
analyzed: sa tadā hi āhuteḥ kāla udarśasya tu vaṣaṭkriyā
translated: Then that is the time for the offering, but the Vasat cry is for the new moon.

original: kuheti kokilenokto yaḥ sa kālaḥ samāpyate // / / //
analyzed: kuhā iti kokilena uktaḥ yaḥ sa kālaḥ samāpyate
translated: The time that is said by the cuckoo with the cry Kuha is completed,

analyzed: tad kāla saṃmitā yasmāt amāvāsyā kuhūḥ smṛtā
translated: Since that time is equal to the new moon, the new moon is remembered as Kuhu.

analyzed: sinīvālī pramāṇaḥ tu kṣīṇa śeṣaḥ niśākaraḥ
translated: The remaining waning moon is equal to Sinivāli,

analyzed: ā amāvasyām viśati arkassinī vālī tatas smṛtā
translated: The sun enters the new moon, therefore it is remembered as Sinivāli.

analyzed: anumatyāḥ carākāyāḥ sinīvālyāḥ kuhūm vinā
translated: Except for Anumati, Charakā, Sinivāli, and Kuhu,

analyzed: etāsām dvi lavaḥ kālaḥ kuhū mātram kuhūḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The time of these is two lava units, Kuhu is remembered as just Kuhu.

analyzed: candra sūrya vyatīpāte saṃgate pūrṇimā antare
translated: When the sun and moon are in conjunction in the middle of the full moon,

analyzed: pratipad pratipadyeta parvakālaḥ dvi mātrakaḥ
translated: One should begin the first lunar day, the time of the full moon is two mātras.

analyzed: kālaḥ kahū sinīvālyoḥ sāmudrasya tu madhyataḥ
translated: The time for the Kaha and Husini Valyas is in the middle of the ocean.

analyzed: arka agni maṇḍale some parvakālaḥ kalā samaḥ
translated: In the solar and fiery circles, the time of the Parva is equal to the Kalas in the moon.

original: evaṃ sa śuklapakṣe vai rajanyāṃ parvasaṃdhiṣu // / / //
analyzed: evam sa śukla pakṣe vai rajanyām parvasaṃdhiṣu
translated: Thus, in the bright fortnight, at night, at the conjunctions of the Parva,

analyzed: saṃ pūrma maṇḍalaḥ śrīmān candramāḥ uparajyate
translated: The glorious moon, with its full orb, is eclipsed.

original: yasmādā dāpyāyate somaḥ pañcadaśyāṃ tu pūrṇimā // / / //
analyzed: yasmāt ā dāpyāyate somaḥ pañcadaśyām tu pūrṇimā
translated: From which the moon is nourished, on the fifteenth, in the full moon,

analyzed: daśabhiḥ pañcabhiḥ ca eva kalābhiḥ divasa kramāt
translated: By ten and five Kalas, in due course of days.

analyzed: tasmāt kalāḥ pañcadaśa somena asya tu ṣoḍaśī
translated: Therefore, the fifteen Kalas are of the moon, and the sixteenth is of him.

analyzed: tasmāt somasya bhavati pañcadaśyā a prapām kṣayaḥ
translated: Therefore, on the fifteenth, there is the waning of the moon.

analyzed: iti ete pitaraḥ devāḥ soma pāḥ soma varddhanāḥ
translated: Thus, these are the Pitris, the gods who drink Soma and increase Soma.

analyzed: ārtavāḥ ṛtavaḥ hi ṛddhāḥ devāḥ tān bhāvayanti vai
translated: The seasons are indeed prosperous, the gods nourish them.

analyzed: atas pitṝn pravakṣyāmi māsa śrāddha bhujaḥ tu ye
translated: Therefore, I will speak of the Pitris, those who eat the monthly Sraddha.

original: teṣāṃ gatiṃ satattvāṃ ca prāptiṃ śrāddhasya caiva hi /
analyzed: teṣām gatim satattvām ca prāptim śrāddhasya ca eva hi
translated: Their state, their true nature, and the attainment of the Sraddha,

original: na mṛtānāṃ gatiḥ śakyā jñātuṃ na punarāgatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: na mṛtānām gatiḥ śakyā jñātum na punarāgatiḥ
translated: The state of the dead cannot be known, nor their return.

analyzed: tapasā api prasiddhena kiṃpunar māsacakṣuṣā
translated: Even by well-known austerities, what to speak of the eye of the month.

analyzed: anu deva pitṝn ete pitaraḥ laukikāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The ancestors of the gods are known as the celestial ancestors, and the ancestors of human beings are known as the worldly ancestors.

analyzed: devāḥ saumyāḥ ca kāvyāḥ ca ayajvānaḥ hi aconijāḥ
translated: The gods are of two types - the gentle and the poetic, and those who do not perform sacrifices and are not born from wombs.

analyzed: devāḥ te pitaraḥ sarve devāḥ tān vādayanti uta
translated: All those gods are ancestors, and the gods worship them.

analyzed: manuṣya pitaraḥ ca eva tebhyaḥ nye laukikāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The human ancestors and others are known as worldly ancestors.

analyzed: pitā pitāmahaḥ ca api tathā yaḥ prapitāmahaḥ
translated: The father, grandfather, and great-grandfather,

original: yajvāno ye tu sāmena somavantastu te smṛtāḥ /🔽ye yajvāno haviryajñe te vai barhiṣadaḥ smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yajvānaḥ ye tu sāmena somavantaḥ tu te smṛtāḥ  ye yajvānaḥ haviḥ yajñe te vai barhiṣadaḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: those who perform sacrifices with the Sāman hymns and have Soma are known as Soma-drinkers.🔽Those who perform sacrifices with oblations are known as the seat-of-kuśa-grass-sitters.

analyzed: agniṣvāttāḥ smṛtāḥ teṣām hominaḥ yājya yājinaḥ
translated: The fire-worshippers are known as those who offer oblations and those who sacrifice for those who are not fit to sacrifice.

analyzed: teṣām tu dharma sādharmyāt smṛtāḥ sāyujya gāḥ dvijaiḥ
translated: Due to their similarity in righteousness, they are known by the twice-born as attaining union with Brahman.

analyzed: ye ca api āśrama dharmāṇām prasthāneṣu vyavasthitāḥ
translated: And those who are established in the stages of life and duties,

original: ante tu nāvasīdanti śraddhāyuktāstu karmasu // / / //🔽tapasā brahmacaryeṇa yajñena prajayā ca vai /
analyzed: ante tu na avasīdanti śraddhā yuktāḥ tu karmasu  tapasā brahmacaryeṇa yajñena prajayā ca vai
translated: but do not fall into despair at the end, being endowed with faith in actions,🔽by austerity, celibacy, sacrifice, progeny,

original: śrāddhena vidyayā caiva pradānena ca saptadhā // / / //
analyzed: śrāddhena vidyayā ca eva pradānena ca saptadhā
translated: by Śrāddha, knowledge, and gift, in seven ways,

analyzed: karmasu eteṣu ye yuktāḥ bhavanti ā deha pātanāt
translated: those who are engaged in these actions until the fall of the body,

analyzed: daivaiḥ taiḥ pitṛbhiḥ sārddham sūkṣma jaiḥ soma yājanaiḥ
translated: along with those gods, ancestors, and subtle ones who perform sacrifices to Soma.

analyzed: svar gatāḥ divi modante pitṛvattaḥ upāsate
translated: Having gone to heaven, they rejoice in heaven, and worship like ancestors.

original: teṣāṃ nivāpe datte tu tatkulīnaiśca bandhubhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: teṣām nivāpe datte tu tad kulīnaiḥ ca bandhubhiḥ
translated: When the funeral rites are performed by their relatives belonging to the same family,

analyzed: māsa śrāddha bhujaḥ tṛptim labhante soma laukikāḥ
translated: those in the world of Soma obtain satisfaction by eating the monthly śrāddha offerings.

analyzed: ete manuṣya pitaraḥ māsa śrāddha bhujaḥ tu ye
translated: Those who are human ancestors and eat the monthly śrāddha offerings,

analyzed: tebhyaḥ pare tu ye pi anye saṃkīrṇāḥ karma yoniṣu
translated: but there are others who are mixed in the wombs of those engaged in actions,

analyzed: bhraṣṭāḥ ca āśrama dharmebhyaḥ svadhā svāhā vivarjitāḥ  bhinna dehāḥ durātmānaḥ preta bhūtāḥ yama kṣaye
translated: and who have fallen from the duties of the stages of life, devoid of svadhā and svāhā,🔽having separated bodies, evil-minded, become ghosts in Yama's abode,

analyzed: sva karmāṇi a nuśocantaḥ yātanā sthānam āgatāḥ  dīrgha āyuṣaḥ tiśuṣkāḥ ca śmaśrulāḥ ca vivāsasaḥ
translated: lamenting their own actions, having come to the place of torment,🔽long-lived, very dry, with long beards and ragged clothes,

analyzed: kṣudh pipāsā parītāḥ ca vidravantaḥ tatas tatas
translated: afflicted by hunger and thirst, running here and there,

analyzed: sarit saraḥ taḍāgāni vāpīḥ ca api upalipsavaḥ  para annāni ca lipsaṃtaḥ kālyamānāḥ tatas tatas
translated: desiring rivers, lakes, ponds, and pools,🔽desiring the food of others, being tormented here and there,

analyzed: sthāneṣu pātyamānāḥ ca yātanāḥ ca punar punar
translated: being struck in various places, and being tormented again and again,

original: śālmale vaitaraṇyāṃ ca kuṃbhīpāke tathaiva ca // / / //🔽karaṃbhavālukāyāṃ ca asipatravane tathā /
analyzed: śālmale vaitaraṇyām ca kuṃbhīpāke tathā eva ca  karaṃbha vālukāyām ca asipatravane tathā
translated: In the Shalmali, Vaitarani, and Kumbhipaka hells,🔽In the Karambha-valuka and Asipatravana forests,

analyzed: śilā saṃpeṣaṇe ca eva pātyamānāḥ sva karmabhiḥ
translated: And in the Shila-sampeshana hell, they are being punished for their own actions.

original: tatrasthānāṃ hi teṣāṃ vai duḥ khitānāmanāśinām /
analyzed: tatrasthānām hi teṣām vai duḥ khitānām anāśinām
translated: For those who are there, suffering and without hope,

analyzed: teṣām loka antara sthānām bāndhavaiḥ nāma gotrataḥ
translated: Their relatives, who are in other worlds, by their name and gotra,

analyzed: bhūmau asavyam darbheṣu dattāḥ piṇḍāḥ trayaḥ tu vai
translated: On the ground, to the left, on the darbha grass, the three piṇḍas are offered.

analyzed: yānti tāḥ tarpayante ca preta sthāneṣu adhiṣṭhitān
translated: They go and satisfy those who are established in the abodes of the departed.

original: aprāptā yātanāsthānaṃ prabhraṣṭā ya ca pañcadhā /🔽paścādye sthāvarānte vai jātā nīcaiḥ svakarmabhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: aprāptāḥ yātanā sthānam prabhraṣṭāḥ ca pañcadhā  paścāt ye sthāvara ante vai jātāḥ nīcaiḥ sva karmabhiḥ
translated: Those who have not yet reached the place of punishment, and those who have fallen in five ways,🔽Later, they are born at the end of the immobile, in low (states) due to their own actions.

analyzed: nānā rūpāsu jāyante tiryagyoniṣu ayoniṣu
translated: They are born in various forms, in the animal realm and in non-wombs.

original: yadāhārā bhavantyete tāsu tāsviha yoniṣu // / / //🔽tasmiṃstasmiṃstadāhāre śrāddhaṃ dattaṃ pratiṣṭhate /
analyzed: yad āhārāḥ bhavanti ete tāsu tāsu iha yoniṣu  tasmin tasmin tad āhāre śrāddham dattam pratiṣṭhate
translated: Whatever food they have in those wombs here,🔽In that and that food, the śrāddha is established,

analyzed: kāle nyāya āgatam pātre vidhinā pratipāditam
translated: Given at the right time, obtained righteously, offered according to the rules to a worthy recipient.

analyzed: prāpnoti annam yathādattam jantuḥ yatra avatiṣṭhate
translated: The food is obtained as given, wherever the creature resides.

original: yathā goṣu pranaṣṭāmu vatso vindati mātaram // / / //
analyzed: yathā goṣu pranaṣṭāmu vatsaḥ vindati mātaram
translated: As a calf finds its mother among a thousand cows,

original: tathā śrāddheṣu dattānnaṃ mantraḥ prāpayate pitṝn /
analyzed: tathā śrāddheṣu datta annam mantraḥ prāpayate pitṝn
translated: In the same way, the mantra causes the food given in the śrāddha to reach the ancestors.

original: evaṃ hyaviphalaṃ śrāddhaṃ śraddhādattaṃ tu mantrataḥ // / / //
analyzed: evam hi aviphalam śrāddham śraddhā dattam tu mantrataḥ
translated: Thus, the śrāddha is not fruitless, when given with faith and with the recitation of mantras.

analyzed: tat tat kumāraḥ provāca paśyan divyena cakṣuṣā
translated: The Kumāra, seeing with his divine eye, spoke thus:

original: gatāgatajñaḥ pretānāṃ prāptiṃ śrāddhasya taiḥ saha // / / //
analyzed: gatāgata jñaḥ pretānām prāptim śrāddhasya taiḥ saha
translated: Knowing the comings and goings of the departed ones, he saw the attainment of the śrāddha with them.

analyzed: vāhlīkāḥ ca ūṣmapāḥ ca eva divākīrtyāḥ ca te smṛtāḥ
translated: The Bāhlikas, Uṣmapas, and Divākirtyas are remembered as such.

analyzed: kṛṣṇapakṣaḥ tu ahar teṣām śuklaḥ svapnāya śarvarī
translated: For them, the dark fortnight is the day, the bright fortnight is the night for sleeping.

original: ityete pitaro devā devāśca pitaraśca vai /
analyzed: iti ete pitaraḥ devāḥ devāḥ ca pitaraḥ ca vai
translated: Thus, these ancestors are the gods, and the gods are the ancestors.

analyzed: ṛtu artava arddha māsāḥ tu anyonyam pitaraḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The seasons, half-months, and months are remembered as ancestors of each other.

analyzed: iti eta pitaraḥ devāḥ manuṣya pitaraḥ ca ye
translated: Thus, these ancestors are the gods, and the human ancestors.

analyzed: prīteṣu teṣu prīyante śrāddha yukteṣu karmasu
translated: When they are pleased, they are pleased in the rites connected with the śrāddha.

analyzed: iti eṣa vicayaḥ proktaḥ pitṝṇām soma pāyinām
translated: Thus, this classification has been told of the ancestors who drink Soma.

original: evaṃ pitṛsatattvaṃ hi purāṇe niścayaṃ gatam // / / //
analyzed: evam pitṛ sa tattvam hi purāṇe niścayam gatam

translated: The declarations of the Vedas are the same in every age, though they are changed in form.🔽The Kshatriyas perform the sacrifices of initiation, the Vaishyas the sacrifices with oblations,

analyzed: paricāra yajñāḥ śūdrāḥ tu japa yajñāḥ dvijottamāḥ

analyzed: kriyāvantaḥ prajāvantaḥ samṛddhāḥ sukhinaḥ tathā

analyzed: brāhmaṇān anurttante kṣatriyāḥ kṣatriyān viśaḥ

analyzed: vaiśya anuvarttinaḥ śudrāḥ parasparam anuvratāḥ

analyzed: śubhāḥ pravṛttayaḥ teṣām dharmāḥ varṇa āśramāḥ tathā

analyzed: saṃkalpitena manasā vācā uktena sva karmaṇā

analyzed: tretā yuge ca viphalaḥ karma āraṃbhaḥ prasiddhi ati

analyzed: āyuḥ medhāḥ balam rūpam ārogyam dharma śīla tā

analyzed: paraspara virodhena manum tāḥ punar abhyayus

analyzed: punar svāyaṃbhuvaḥ dṛṣṭvā yāthātathyam prajāpatiḥ

analyzed: priyavrata uttānapādau prathamau tau mohīkṣitau

translated: From then on, kings were born as upholders of the rod of punishment.

analyzed: prajānām rañjanāt ca eva rājānaḥ te bhavat nṛpāḥ

analyzed: varṇānām pravibhāgāḥ ca tretāyām saṃprakīrttitāḥ

analyzed: bhāryā purohitaḥ ca eva senā nī rathakṛt ca yaḥ

analyzed: rājānaḥ śūdra bhūyiṣṭhāḥ pākhaṇḍānām pravarttakāḥ

analyzed: guṇa hīnāḥ prajāḥ ca eva tadā vai saṃpravarttate

analyzed: śūdrāḥ ca brāhmaṇa ācārāḥ śūdra ācārāḥ ca brāhmaṇāḥ

analyzed: rāja vṛttāḥ sthitāḥ corāḥ cora ācārāḥ ca pārthivāḥ

analyzed: bhṛtyāḥ ete hi a su bhṛtaḥ yuga ante samavasthite

analyzed: aśīlinyaḥ nṛtāḥ ca eva striyaḥ madya āmiṣa priyāḥ
translated: Women are of bad character and false, and they are fond of wine and meat.

analyzed: māyāvinyaḥ bhaviṣyanti yuga ante muni sattama

analyzed: ekapatnyaḥ na śiṣyanti yuga ante muni sattama
translated: There will be no women who are faithful to their husbands, O best of sages, at the end of the Yuga.

analyzed: śvāpada prabala tvam ca gavām ca eva hi upakṣayaḥ

analyzed: sādhūnām vinivṛttim ca vidyāḥ tasmin yuga kṣaye

analyzed: tadā dharmaḥ mahā udarke durlabhaḥ dāna mūlavān

analyzed: cātura āśrama śaithilyaḥ dharmaḥ pravicariṣyati

analyzed: tadā hi alpa phalā bhūmiḥ kvacid ca api mahā phalā

analyzed: na rakṣitāraḥ boktāraḥ bali bhāgasya pārthivāḥ
translated: The kings will not protect or enjoy the share of the sacrificial offerings.

analyzed: yuga ante ca bhaviṣyanti sva rakṣaṇa parāyaṇāḥ

analyzed: arakṣitāraḥ rājānaḥ viprāḥ śūdra upajīvinaḥ
translated: The kings will not protect, the Brahmanas will live on the Shudras,

analyzed: śūdra abhivādinaḥ sarve yuga ante dvijasattamāḥ
translated: and all the best of the twice-born will be saluted by the Shudras at the end of the Yuga.

analyzed: adṛśūlāḥ janapadāḥ śiva śūlāḥ dvijāḥ tathā
translated: The countries will be without prosperity, the Brahmanas will be without prosperity,

analyzed: pramadāḥ keśa śūlāḥ ca yugānte samupasthite
translated: and the women will be without prosperity when the end of the Yuga has arrived.

analyzed: tapaḥ yajña phalānām ca vikretāraḥ dvijottamāḥ
translated: The best of the Brahmanas will sell the fruits of austerities and sacrifices,

analyzed: yatayaḥ ca bhaviṣyanti smin kalau yuge
translated: and there will be many ascetics in this Kali age.

analyzed: citra varṣī yadā devaḥ tadā prāhuḥ yuga kṣayam
translated: When the god rains in a variegated manner, then they declare the end of the Yuga.

analyzed: sarve vāṇijakāḥ ca a pi bhaviṣyanti adhame yuge

analyzed: bhūyiṣṭham kūṭa mānaiḥ ca paṇyam vikrīṇate janāḥ

analyzed: kuśīla caryā pākhaṇḍaiḥ vyādha rūpaiḥ samāvṛtam

analyzed: puruṣa alpam bahu strīkam yuga ante samupasthite
translated: When the end of the yuga has arrived, there will be few men and many women.

translated: People will beg from each other for the sake of their arms.🔽One will not speak without being asked, will speak harshly, will not be straightforward or free from malice.

original: na kṛte pratikarttā ca yuge kṣīṇe bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: na kṛte pratikarttā ca yuge kṣīṇe bhaviṣyati
translated: And one will not repay a favor when the yuga is declining.

analyzed: aśaṅkā ca eva patite yugānte tasya lakṣaṇam
translated: And lack of suspicion even towards the fallen - this is the characteristic of the end of the yuga.

analyzed: tatas śūnya vasumatī bhaviṣyati vasundharā
translated: Then the earth, the land, will become empty.

analyzed: goptāraḥ ca api a goptāraḥ prabhaviṣyanti śāsakāḥ

analyzed: pranaṣṭa ceṣṭanāḥ dhūrttāḥ mukta keśāsttva śūlinaḥ

analyzed: ūna ṣoḍaśa varṣāḥ ca prajāḥ yante yuga kṣaye

analyzed: śukla dantāḥ jita akṣāḥ ca muṇḍāḥ kāṣāya vāsasaḥ
translated: They will have white teeth, conquered senses, be shaven, and wear ochre robes.

analyzed: śūdrā dharmam cariṣyati yugānte samupasthite

analyzed: sasya corāḥ bhaviṣyanti tathā caila apahāriṇaḥ
translated: There will be thieves of corn and thieves of clothes.

analyzed: corāt corāḥ ca harttāraḥ hartuḥ harttā tathā aparaḥ
translated: And thieves will rob thieves, and other thieves will rob the robbers.

analyzed: loke niṣkriya tām gate
translated: When knowledge and action will cease to exist in the world, and when all will become inactive,

analyzed: kīṭa mūṣaka sarpāḥ ca dharṣayiṣyanti mānavān
translated: Insects, mice and snakes will afflict men.

analyzed: abhīkṣṇam kṣemam ārogyam sāmarthyam durlabham tathā

analyzed: kauśikān prativatsyanti deśāḥ kṣudh bhaya pīḍitāḥ
translated: The countries, afflicted by hunger and fear, will be inhabited by the Kaushikas.

analyzed: duḥkhena abhiplutānām ca parama āyuḥ śatam tadā
translated: And the highest age of those overwhelmed with misery will be a hundred years.

original: dṛśyante ca na dṛśyante vedā kaliyuge 'khilāḥ /
analyzed: dṛśyante ca na dṛśyante kali yuge khilāḥ
translated: And the Vedas, in their entirety, will be seen and not seen in the Kali age.

analyzed: tat sīdante tathā yajñāḥ kevala adharma pīḍitāḥ
translated: And the sacrifices, afflicted solely by unrighteousness, will decline.

analyzed: tathā kāpālikāḥ ca ha
translated: And there will be those wearing red garments, those without knots, and those with skulls,

analyzed: pare
translated: And others selling the Vedas, and others selling the sacred places.

analyzed: varṇa āśramāṇām ye ca anye pākhaṇḍāḥ paripanthinaḥ
translated: And those other heretics who are obstacles to the castes and stages of life,

original: utpadyante tadā te vai saṃprāpte tu kalau yuge // / / //
analyzed: utpadyante tadā te vai saṃprāpte tu kalau yuge
translated: Will arise then, when the Kali age has arrived.

analyzed: adhīyate tadā vedān śūdrāḥ dharma artha kovidāḥ
translated: Then the Shudras, well-versed in religion and profit, study the Vedas.

analyzed: yajante ca aśvamedhena rājānaḥ śūdra yonayaḥ
translated: Kings of Shudra caste perform the horse-sacrifice.

analyzed: strī bāla go vadham kṛtvā hatvā anye ca parasparam
translated: Having killed women, children, and cows, and having killed one another,

translated: and having robbed one another, the people then succeed.🔽The preaching of misery, short life, and little bodily strength due to disease,

analyzed: adharma abhiniveśi tvāt tamaḥ vṛttam kalau smṛtam

analyzed: prajāsu bhrūṇa hatyā ca tadā vairāt pravarttate
translated: Then abortion is practised among the people through enmity.

analyzed: tasmāt āyuḥ balam rūpam kalim prāpya prahīyate

analyzed: tadā ca alpena kālena siddhim gacchanti mānavāḥ

analyzed: dhanyāḥ dharmam cariṣyanti yuga ante dvijasattamāḥ

analyzed: śruti smṛti uditam dharmam ye caranti anasūyakāḥ

analyzed: tretāyām ābdikaḥ dharmaḥ dvāpare māsikaḥ smṛtaḥ

analyzed: yathāśakti caran prājñaḥ tat ahnā prāpnuyāt kalau

analyzed: saṃdhyā svabhāvāḥ sva aṃśeṣu pāda śeṣāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ

analyzed: anukarṣan sa vai senām sa vāji ratha kuñjarām

analyzed: pragṛhīta āyudhaiḥ vipraiḥ sahasraśas

analyzed: tathā eva dākṣiṇātyān ca draviḍān siṃhalaiḥ saha

analyzed: laṃpākārān sakatakān kirātānām ca jātayaḥ

analyzed: pravṛtta cakraḥ balavān mlecchānām anta kṛt prabhuḥ

analyzed: adṛṣṭaḥ sarva bhūtānām cacāra atha vasundharām

analyzed: mādhavasya tu sa oṃśena devasya iha vijajñivān
translated: He was born here as a part of Lord Madhava,

analyzed: pūrva janmani vikhyātaḥ pramatiḥ nāma vīryavān
translated: In his previous birth, he was known as the powerful Pramati,

analyzed: vinighnan sarva bhūtāni mānavān eva sarvaśas

translated: due to mutual enmity and sudden anger,🔽having almost completely destroyed the unrighteous Mleccha tribes,

analyzed: gaṅgā yamunayoḥ madhye niṣṭhām prāptaḥ saha anugaḥ
translated: he attained his end along with his followers in the land between the Ganges and Yamuna rivers.

translated: Then, after the Kalpa was over, in the general war,

analyzed: apagrahāḥ tatas tāḥ vai lobha āviṣṭāḥ tu vṛndaśas
translated: they became greedy and gathered in groups,

analyzed: ca anyonyam pothayantaḥ parasparam

analyzed: arājake yuga vaśāt saṃkṣaye samupasthite
translated: In the absence of a king, when the end of the Yuga arrived,

analyzed: prajāḥ tāḥ vai tatas sarvāḥ paraspara bhaya ardditāḥ
translated: all the people, afflicted by fear of each other,

analyzed: vyākulāḥ ca paribhrāntāḥ tyaktvā dārān gṛhāṇi ca
translated: became agitated and confused, abandoning their wives and homes,

analyzed: svān praṇān an apekṣantaḥ niṣkāraṇa su duḥkhitāḥ

analyzed: naṣṭe śraute smṛtau dharme paraspara hatāḥ tadā

analyzed: nirmaryādāḥ nirākrandāḥ niḥsnehāḥ nirapatrapāḥ

original: naṣṭe dharme pratihatā hrasvakāḥ pañcaviṃśatim /🔽hitvā putrāṃśca dārāṃśca viṣādavyākuledriyāḥ // / / //

analyzed: anāvṛṣṭi hatāḥ ca eva vārttām utsṛjya duḥkhitāḥ

analyzed: pratyantān tāḥ niṣevante hitvā janapadān svakān

analyzed: saritaḥ sāgara anūpān sevante parvatān tathā

analyzed: māṃsaiḥ mūla phalaiḥ ca eva vartayantaḥ su duḥkhitāḥ  cīra patra acina dharāḥ niṣkriyāḥ niṣparigrahāḥ
translated: Subsisting on meat, roots, and fruits, they will be extremely miserable...🔽Wearing garments of bark, leaves, and rags, without rituals, and without possessions.

translated: Falling from the social classes and stages of life, they will resort to terrible mixing.🔽Having reached this state of degeneration, the remaining people...

analyzed: vicāraṇā tu nirvedāt sāmya avasthā vicāraṇāt

analyzed: sāmya avasthā ātmakaḥ bodhaḥ saṃbodhāt dharma śīla tā
translated: The knowledge of the state of equilibrium, the virtuous conduct from perfect knowledge,

analyzed: tāsu upaśama yuktāsu kali śiṣṭāsu vai svayam
translated: In those that are united with tranquility, the remnants of Kali age, by himself.

analyzed: ahorātram tadā tāsām yuga ante parivarttini
translated: Day and night, then, at the end of the yuga, when it was turning,

analyzed: citta saṃmohanam kṛtvā tāsām vai supta matta vat  bhāvinā ṛthasya ca balāt tatas kṛtam avarttata
translated: Having caused confusion in their minds, they slept like intoxicated ones.🔽And by the power of the future object, then the done was made.

original: pravṛtte tu tatastasminpūte kṛtayuge tu vai // / / //
analyzed: pravṛtte tu tatas tasmin pūte kṛta yuge tu vai
translated: But when that was begun, in the purified Kṛta age,

analyzed: utpannāḥ kali śiṣṭāsu prajāḥ kārtayugāḥ tadā
translated: The people born in the remnants of the Kali age, then in the Kṛta age,

original: tiṣṭhanti ceha ye siddhā adṛṣṭā vicaranti ca // / / //
analyzed: tiṣṭhanti ca iha ye siddhāḥ adṛṣṭāḥ vicaranti ca
translated: And those perfected ones who remain here, unseen, wander about.

original: saha saptarṣibhiścaiva tatra te ca vyavasthitāḥ /
analyzed: saha saptarṣibhiḥ ca eva tatra te ca vyavasthitāḥ

analyzed: brahma kṣatra viśaḥ śūdrāḥ bīja artham ye smṛtāḥ iha
translated: The Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas and Shudras, who are said to be for the sake of seed,

analyzed: kali jaiḥ saha te saṃti nirviśeṣāḥ tadā abhavan
translated: They are with the Kali ones, then they became without distinction.

analyzed: teṣām saptarṣayaḥ dharmam kathayanti itareṣu ca

analyzed: manvantareṣu sarveṣu atīta anāgateṣu iha

analyzed: indra loka pratiṣṭhāḥ tu sarve rājarṣayaḥ matāḥ

analyzed: abhijātyā atha tapasā mantra vyāharaṇaiḥ tathā

analyzed: ete rāja ṛṣayaḥ yuktāḥ devāḥ dvija nṛpāḥ ca ye

analyzed: kṛta tretā ādi saṃyuktam caturyugam iti smṛtam
translated: The period consisting of four Yugas, namely Kṛta, Tretā, etc., is known as a Yuga.

analyzed: tat ca ekasaptati guṇam parivṛttam tu sa adhikam
translated: That is multiplied by seventy-one and a little more.

analyzed: manoḥ etam adhīkāram provāca bhagavān prabhuḥ
translated: The Lord, the Supreme Being, has declared this to be the period of Manu.

original: evaṃ manvantarāṇāṃ ca sarveṣāmeva lakṣaṇam /🔽atītānāgatānāṃ vai varttimānena kīrttitam // / / //
analyzed: evam manvantarāṇām ca sarveṣām eva lakṣaṇam  atīta anāgatānām vai vartti mānena kīrttitam
translated: Thus the characteristics of all the past, future and present Manvantaras🔽have been described by me.

original: ityeṣa kīttitaḥ sargo manoḥ svāyaṃbhuvasya te /
analyzed: iti eṣa kīttitaḥ sargaḥ manoḥ svāyaṃbhuvasya te
translated: Thus, O son of Pṛthā, the creation of Manu Svāyambhuva has been described to you.

original: pratisaṃdhiṃ tu vakṣyāmi tasya caivāparasya ca // / / //
analyzed: pratisaṃdhim tu vakṣyāmi tasya ca eva aparasya ca
translated: Now I shall describe the beginning of the next one.

analyzed: manvantaram yathā pūrvam ṛṣibhiḥ daivataiḥ saha
translated: As the Manvantara of the past, along with the sages and gods,

analyzed: avaśya bhāvinā arthena yathāvat vinivarttate
translated: comes to an end in accordance with the inevitable future,

analyzed: etasmin antare pūrvam śvarāḥ tu ye
translated: in the meantime, the lords of the three worlds,

analyzed: saptarṣayaḥ ca devāḥ ca pitaraḥ manavaḥ tathā
translated: the seven sages, the gods, the ancestors and the Manus,

original: manvantarasya kāle tu saṃpūrṇe sādhike tadā /
analyzed: manvantarasya kāle tu saṃpūrṇe sādhike tadā
translated: at the end of the complete Manvantara period,

analyzed: kṣīṇe dhikāre saṃvignāḥ buddhvā paryayam ātmanaḥ
translated: when their authority was exhausted, they became anxious, knowing their own destruction.

original: maharlokāya te sarve unmukhā dadhire matim /
analyzed: mahar lokāya te sarve unmukhāḥ dadhire matim
translated: All of them turned their minds towards the Maharloka.

analyzed: tatas manvantare tasmin prakṣīṇe devatāḥ tu tāḥ
translated: Then, in that Manvantara, when the gods were destroyed,

analyzed: tu tiṣṭhet ekam kṛtam yugam
translated: when the period of existence was complete, the Kṛta Yuga remained alone.

analyzed: utpadyante bhaviṣyantaḥ ye vai manvantara īśvarāḥ
translated: Those who will be the lords of the Manvantaras in the future are born.

analyzed: devatāḥ pitaraḥ ca eva ṛṣayaḥ manuḥ eva ca
translated: The gods, the ancestors, the sages, and Manu himself,

original: manvantare tu saṃpūrṇe tadvadante kalau yuge // / / //
analyzed: manvantare tu saṃpūrṇe tadvat ante kalau yuge
translated: at the end of the Manvantara, they say the same in the Kali Yuga.

original: saṃpadyate kṛtaṃ teṣu kaliśiṣṭeṣu vai tadā /
analyzed: saṃpadyate kṛtam teṣu kali śiṣṭeṣu vai tadā
translated: When the remnants of the Kali are over, the Kṛta is accomplished among them then.

original: yathā kṛtasya saṃtānaḥ kalipūrvaḥ smṛto budhaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: yathā kṛtasya saṃtānaḥ kali pūrvaḥ smṛtaḥ budhaiḥ
translated: As the continuity of the Kṛta is remembered by the wise as preceded by the Kali,

analyzed: tathā manvantara anteṣu ādiḥ manvantarasya ca
translated: so is the beginning of the Manvantara at the end of the Manvantaras.

original: kṣīṇe manvantare pūrve pravṛtte cāpare punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṣīṇe manvantare pūrve pravṛtte ca apare punar
translated: When the previous Manvantara is exhausted and another begins again,

original: mukhe kṛtayugasyātha teṣāṃ śiṣṭāstu ye tadā /🔽saptarṣayo manuścaiva kālāpekṣāstu ye sthitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: mukhe kṛta yugasya atha teṣām śiṣṭāḥ tu ye tadā  saptarṣayaḥ manuḥ ca eva kāla apekṣāḥ tu ye sthitāḥ
translated: then at the beginning of the Kṛta Yuga, those who remain,🔽the seven sages, Manu, and those who remain waiting for time,

analyzed: manvantara pratīkṣāḥ te kṣīyamāṇāḥ tapasvinaḥ
translated: those ascetics who are being destroyed, waiting for the Manvantara,

analyzed: manvantara utsavasya arthe saṃtati arthe ca sarvadā
translated: For the sake of the festival of the Manu-period and always for the sake of continuity.

analyzed: pūrvavat saṃpravarttante pravṛtte vṛṣṭi sarjane
translated: As before, they engage in the commencement of the rain-making process.

analyzed: dvandveṣu saṃpravṛtteṣu utpannāsu auṣadhīṣu ca
translated: When the pairs engage in intercourse and the herbs are produced,

analyzed: prajāsu ca aniketāsu saṃsthitāsu kvacid kvacid
translated: and when the people, without fixed abodes, settle down in various places,

original: vārttāyāṃ saṃpravṛttāyāṃ dharme caivopasaṃsthite // / / //🔽nirānande cāpi loke naṣṭe sthāvarajaṅgame /
analyzed: vārttāyām saṃpravṛttāyām dharme ca eva upasaṃsthite  nirānande ca api loke naṣṭe sthāvara jaṅgame
translated: when the news spreads and righteousness is established,🔽and when the world, with its moving and unmoving beings, becomes joyless and destroyed,

analyzed: a grāma nagare ca eva varṇa āśrama vivarjite
translated: and when there are no villages or cities, and when the social classes and stages of life are abandoned,

analyzed: pūrva manvantare śiṣṭāḥ ye bhavanti iha dhārmikāḥ
translated: the righteous ones who remain from the previous Manu-period,

analyzed: saptarṣayaḥ manuḥ ca eva saṃtāna artham vyavasthitāḥ
translated: the seven sages and Manu, remain for the sake of continuity.

analyzed: prajā artham tapatām teṣām tapaḥ parama duścaram
translated: For the sake of offspring, they perform austerities that are extremely difficult to perform.

analyzed: utpadyante hi pūrveṣām nidhaneṣu iha pūrvavat
translated: As before, they are born in the deaths of their predecessors.

analyzed: deva asurāḥ pitṛ gaṇāḥ ṛṣayaḥ mānuṣāḥ tathā
translated: The gods, demons, groups of ancestors, sages, humans,

analyzed: sarpāḥ bhūta piśācāḥ ca gandharvāḥ yakṣa rākṣasāḥ
translated: serpents, ghosts, spirits, gandharvas, yakshas, and rakshasas,

analyzed: tatas teṣām tu ye śiṣṭāḥ śiṣṭa ācārān prajakṣate
translated: then those who remain among them, they follow the conduct of the righteous.

analyzed: saptarṣayaḥ hi ādau manvantarasya hi
translated: The seven sages and Manu, at the beginning of the Manvantara,

original: prārabhante ca karmāṇi manuṣyo daivataiḥ saha /
analyzed: prārabhante ca karmāṇi manuṣyaḥ daivataiḥ saha
translated: And the human beings, along with the gods, commence their activities.

original: ṛṣīṇāṃ brahmacaryeṇa gatvānṛṇyaṃ tu va tadā // / / //
analyzed: ṛṣīṇām brahmacaryeṇa gatvā ānṛṇyam tu tadā
translated: Then the sages, by their celibacy, become free from debt to the ancestors,

analyzed: pitṝṇām prajāyā ca eva devānām ijyayā tathā
translated: And by the worship of the gods, to the gods and offspring.

analyzed: śatam varṣa sahasrāṇām dharme varṇa ātmake sthitāḥ
translated: They remain for a hundred thousand years in the Dharma based on the castes.

analyzed: trayī vārttā daṇḍanītiḥ dharmān varṇa āśramān tathā
translated: The three Vedas, worldly knowledge, and the science of punishment, and the duties of the castes and stages of life,

analyzed: sthāpayitvā āśramān ca eva svargāya dedhire manaḥ
translated: Having established the stages of life, they turn their minds to heaven.

analyzed: pūrvadeveṣu teṣu evam svargāya abhimukheṣu vai
translated: When those former gods thus turn their faces towards heaven,

analyzed: pūrvadevāḥ tatas te vai sthitāḥ dharmeṇa kṛtsnaśas
translated: Then those former gods, having completely established themselves in righteousness,

analyzed: manvantare purāvṛtte sthānāni utsṛjya sarvaśas
translated: In a former Manvantara, having abandoned their positions entirely,

analyzed: mantraiḥ saha ūrdhvam gacchanti mahar lokam anāmayam
translated: They go upwards with the mantras to the faultless Maharloka.

analyzed: vinivṛtta adhikārāḥ te mānasīm siddhim āsthitāḥ
translated: Having turned away from their duties, they attain mental perfection,

analyzed: avekṣamāṇāḥ vaśinaḥ tiṣṭhantyāḥ bhūta saṃplavāt
translated: And remain in control, observing, until the dissolution of beings.

analyzed: tatas teṣu vyatīteṣu pūrvadeveṣu vai tadā
translated: Then, when those former gods have passed away,

analyzed: śūnyeṣu deva sthāneṣu trailokye teṣu sarvaśas
translated: In the empty abodes of the gods, in all those three worlds,

original: upasthitā ihānye vai ye devāḥ svargavāsinaḥ /
analyzed: upasthitāḥ iha anye vai ye devāḥ svarga vāsinaḥ
translated: and the other gods who reside in heaven have assembled here.

analyzed: tatas te tapasā yuktāḥ sthānāni āpūrayanti ca
translated: Then, endowed with austerity, they fill up the abodes,

analyzed: satyena brahmacaryeṇa śrutena ca samanvitāḥ
translated: endowed with truth, celibacy, and learning.

analyzed: saptarṣīṇām manoḥ ca eva devānām pitṛbhiḥ saha
translated: Along with the seven sages, the mind, the gods, and the ancestors,

analyzed: nidhanāni iha pūrveṣām āditām ca bhaviṣyatām
translated: the deaths here of the former ones and the beginning of the future ones,

analyzed: teṣām saṃtati avicchedaḥ iha āmanvantara kṣayāt
translated: the continuity of which is uninterrupted here due to the destruction of the Manvantaras,

analyzed: evam pūrva ānupūrvyeṇa sthitiḥ teṣām avasthitā
translated: thus their existence is established in due order,

analyzed: manvantareṣu sarveṣu yāvat ābhūtasaṃplavam
translated: in all the Manvantaras until the dissolution of all beings,

analyzed: pūrva manvantarāṇām tu pratisaṃdhāna lakṣaṇam
translated: the characteristics of the conjunctions of the former Manvantaras,

analyzed: atīta anāgatānām vai proktam svāyaṃbhuvena tu
translated: have been stated by the self-existent one regarding the past and future,

analyzed: manvantareṣu atīteṣu bhaviṣyāṇām tu sādhanam
translated: in the past Manvantaras, but the means of existence in the future ones,

analyzed: evam saṃtati avicchedaḥ bhavati ā bhūta saṃplavāt
translated: thus the continuity is uninterrupted until the dissolution of all beings.

analyzed: manvantarāṇām parivarttanāni hi ekāntataḥ tāni mahar gatāni
translated: The cycles of the Manvantaras are indeed entirely immersed in the great one.

original: mahājanaṃ caiva janāntapaśca caikāntagāni prabhavanti satye // / / //
analyzed: mahājanam ca eva jana antapaḥ ca ca ekānta gāni prabhavanti satye
translated: And the great people and those at the end of the people, they attain the ultimate in truth.

original: tadbhāvināṃ tatra tu darśanena nānātvadṛṣṭena ca pratyayena /
analyzed: tad bhāvinām tatra tu darśanena nānātva dṛṣṭena ca pratyayena
translated: By the vision of that which is to come, and by the various views and conditions,

original: stye sthitā nityatayā tu nityaṃ prāpte vikāre pratisarga kāle // / / //
analyzed: stye sthitā nitya tayā tu nityam prāpte vikāre pratisarga kāle
translated: They abide in truth, but by eternity they are eternal, when the creation is destroyed at the end of the kalpa.

original: manvantarāṇāṃ parivarttanāni muñcanti satyaṃ tu tato 'parānta /
analyzed: manvantarāṇām parivarttanāni muñcanti satyam tu
translated: The changes of the Manu periods let go of truth, but after that,

analyzed: tatas bhiyogāḥ viṣaya prahāṇāt viśanti nārāyaṇam eva devam
translated: Then by application, from the abandonment of objects, they enter into Narayana, the god alone.

analyzed: manvantarāṇām parivarttaneṣu cira pravṛtteṣu vidhi svabhāvāt
translated: In the changes of the Manu periods, which have been going on for a long time, by the nature of the ritual,

original: kṣaṇaṃ na vai tiṣṭhati jīvalokaḥ kṣayodayābhyāṃ parivartamānaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṣaṇam na vai tiṣṭhati jīva lokaḥ kṣaya udayābhyām parivartamānaḥ
translated: The world of living beings does not stand still for a moment, changing by destruction and rise.

analyzed: iti antarāṇi evam ṛṣi stutānām dharma ātmanām divya dṛśām manūnām
translated: Thus the intermediate periods of the Manu periods, praised by the sages, of the righteous ones with divine vision,

analyzed: vāyu praṇītāni upalabhya dṛśyāt divya ojasām vyāsa samāsa yogaiḥ
translated: Having perceived the divine energies by the methods of Vyasa and Samasa, from the visible world,

analyzed: sarvāṇi rājarṣi surarthimanti brahmarṣi deva uragavanti ca eva
translated: All the royal sages, the gods, the great sages, and the Brahmana sages, the gods, and the serpents,

analyzed: sureśa saptarṣi pitṛ prajā īśaiḥ yuktāni samyak parivarttanāni
translated: The proper revolutions of the planets, along with the lords of the gods, the seven sages, the manes, and the Prajapatis.

analyzed: udāra vaṃśa abhijana śrutīnām prakṛṣṭa medhā abhisamedhitānām
translated: Of those who are born in noble families, who are well-versed in the Vedas, who are endowed with excellent intelligence,

analyzed: kīrti dyuti khyātibhiḥ arcitānām puṇyam hi viśyāpanam īśvarāṇām
translated: Who are revered by fame, radiance, and renown, the merit of the lords is indeed extensive.

analyzed: svargīyam etat paramam pavitram putrīyam etat ca param rahasyam
translated: This is the supreme and sacred of heavenly matters, this is the supreme secret of progeny.

analyzed: japyam mahā parvasu ca etat agryam duḥkha apaśānti pradam āyuṣīyam
translated: This is the foremost Japa to be performed on great Parvas, it bestows the alleviation of sorrow and longevity.

analyzed: praja śada varṣim anupradhānām puṇyām prasūtim prathitām ajasya
translated: The illustrious birth of the unborn, led by Manu, the lord of creatures, is praised, which is full of merit.

original: mamāpi vikhyāpayataḥ samāsātsiddhiṃ prajeśāḥ pradiśantu yuktāḥ // / / //
analyzed: mama api vikhyāpayataḥ samāsāt siddhim prajā īśāḥ pradiśantu yuktāḥ
translated: May the lords of creatures, who are properly engaged, grant me success as I proclaim it in brief.

analyzed: iti etat antaram proktam manoḥ svāyaṃbhuvasya ca
translated: Thus has been described the history of Manu Svayambhuva,

analyzed: vistareṇa ānupūrvyā ca bhūyas kim varṇayāmi aham
translated: in detail and in due order. What more shall I describe?

original: iti śrībrahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyuprokte pūrvabhāge dvitīye 'nuṣgapāde vedavyasanākhyānaṃ svāyaṃbhuvamanvantaravarṇanaṃ ca nāma pañcatriṃśattamo
analyzed: iti śrī brahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyu prokte pūrva bhāge dvitīye nuṣga pāde vedavyasanākhyānam svāyaṃbhuvamanvantaravarṇanam ca nāma pañcatriṃśattamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirty-fifth chapter, named the narration of the Vedavyasa and the description of the Svayambhuva Manvantara, in the first section called the Birth of the Being in the great Purana called Brahma-Vaivarta.

analyzed: śāṃśapāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Shanshapāyana said:

analyzed: manvantarāṇi śeṣāṇi śrotum icchāmi anukramāt
translated: I wish to hear about the remaining Manvantaras in order,

analyzed: manvantara adhipān ca eva śakra deva purogamān
translated: and about the lords of the Manvantaras, headed by Shakra and the gods.

analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Sūta said:

analyzed: manvantarāṇi yāni syuḥ atīta anāgatāni ha
translated: The Manvantaras that have passed and those that will come,

analyzed: samāsāḥ dvistarāt ca eva bruvataḥ me nibodhata
translated: I will tell you in brief and in two parts. Listen to me.

analyzed: svāyaṃbhuvaḥ manuḥ pūrvam manuḥ svārociṣaḥ tathā
translated: The first Manu was Svāyambhuva, then Svārociṣa,

analyzed: uttamaḥ tāmasaḥ ca eva raivataḥ cākṣuṣaḥ tathā
translated: Uttama, Tāmasa, Raivata, and Cākṣuṣa.

analyzed: ṣaṭ ete tītāḥ vakṣyāmi aṣṭau anāgatān
translated: These are the six past Manus. I will now tell you about the eight future Manus.

analyzed: sāvarṇiḥ ca eva raucyaḥ ca bhautyaḥ vaivasvataḥ tathā
translated: They are Sāvarṇi, Raucya, Bhautya, and Vaivasvata.

analyzed: vakṣyāmi etān purastāt tu manoḥ vevasvatasya ca
translated: I will tell you about them before the present Manu Vaivasvata.

analyzed: manavaḥ pañca ye tītāḥ mānasān tān nibodhata
translated: Know the five past Manus, the sons of Svāyambhuva.

original: manvantaraṃ mayā vo 'dhya krāntaṃ svāyaṃbhuvasya ha /
analyzed: manvantaram mayā vaḥ krāntam svāyaṃbhuvasya ha
translated: I have described to you the Manvantara of Svāyambhuva.

original: ata ūrdhvaṃ pravakṣyāmi manāḥ svārociṣasya ha // / / //
analyzed: atas ūrdhvam pravakṣyāmi manāḥ svārociṣasya ha
translated: Now I will tell you about the second Manu, Svārociṣa.

analyzed: prajā sargam samāsena dvitīyasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: I will describe in brief the creation of beings of the second great Manu.

analyzed: āsan vai tuṣitāḥ devāḥ manoḥ svārociṣe ntare
translated: The gods of Tuṣita were present in the Svārociṣa manvantara.

original: pārāvatāśca vidvāṃso dvāveva tu gaṇau smṛtau /
analyzed: pārāvatāḥ ca vidvāṃsaḥ dvau eva tu gaṇau smṛtau
translated: The Pārāvatas and the Vidyādharas are known as the two groups.

analyzed: tuṣitāyām samutpannāḥ kratoḥ putrāḥ sva rociṣaḥ
translated: The sons of Kratu, born in the Tuṣita heaven, are the sons of Svārociṣa.

original: pārāvatāśca vāsiṣṭhā dvādaśa dvau gaṇau smṛtau /
analyzed: pārāvatāḥ ca vāsiṣṭhāḥ dvādaśa dvau gaṇau smṛtau
translated: The Pārāvatas and the Vāsiṣṭhas are remembered as the two groups of twelve.

analyzed: chanda jāḥ ca caturviṃśat devāḥ te vai tadā smṛtāḥ
translated: The gods born from the Vedas are said to be twenty-four.

analyzed: divasparśaḥ tha jāmitraḥ gopadaḥ bhāsuraḥ tathā
translated: Divaspṛṣṭha, Jāmitra, Gopada, Bhāsura,

analyzed: ajaḥ ca bhagavān ca eva mahā balaḥ
translated: Lord Aja, Draviṇa, Mahābala,

analyzed: āyaḥ ca api mahā bāhuḥ mahā ojāḥ ca api vīryavān
translated: Āya, the mighty-armed one, and the powerful Mahāujas,

analyzed: cikitvān viśrutaḥ yaḥ tu ca aṃśaḥ yaḥ ca eva paṭhyate
translated: the famous Cikitvān, and the one known as Aṃśa,

analyzed: ṛtaḥ ca dvādaśaḥ teṣām tuṣitāḥ parikīrttitāḥ
translated: and Ṛta are said to be the twelve Tuṣitas.

analyzed: iti ete kratu putrāḥ tu tadā āsan soma pāyinaḥ
translated: Thus these were the sons of Kratu, who drank Soma.

analyzed: pracetāḥ ca eva yaḥ devaḥ viśvadevaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: The god Pracetā, and also Viśvadeva,

analyzed: samañjaḥ viśrutaḥ yaḥ tu hi ajihmaḥ ca ari marddanaḥ
translated: the famous Saṃjña, the one who is not crooked, and the one who conquers enemies,

analyzed: āyurdānaḥ mahāmānaḥ divyamānaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Āyur-dāna, Mahāmāna, and also Divyamāna,

analyzed: ajeyaḥ ca mahābhāgaḥ yavīyān ca mahā balaḥ
translated: And the youngest was invincible, greatly fortunate, and immensely powerful.

original: hotā yajvā tathā hyete parikrāntāḥ parāvatāḥ /
analyzed: hotā yajvā tathā hi ete parikrāntāḥ parāvatāt
translated: They were the Hotṛ, Yajvan, and those who have gone to the farthest end.

analyzed: iti etāḥ devatāḥ hi āsan manoḥ svārociṣa antare
translated: Thus were these deities in the Svārociṣa Manvantara of Manu.

analyzed: somapāḥ tu tadā hi etāḥ caturviśati devatāḥ
translated: But at that time, these twenty-four deities were the Soma-drinkers.

analyzed: teṣām indraḥ tadā hi āsīt vipaścit loka viśrutaḥ
translated: Among them, Vipaschil, renowned in the world, was then Indra.

original: ūrjā vasiṣṭhaputraśca staṃbaḥ kāśyapa eva ca /
analyzed: ūrjāḥ vasiṣṭha putraḥ ca staṃbaḥ kāśyapaḥ eva ca
translated: Ūrja, the son of Vasiṣṭha, Stambha of the Kāśyapa lineage,

analyzed: bhārgavaḥ ca tadhā prāmaḥ ṛṣabha uṃṅgirasaḥ tathā
translated: Bhārgava, and similarly Prāma, Ṛṣabha of the Aṅgiras lineage,

analyzed: paulastyaḥ ca eva tris ātreyaḥ niścalaḥ tathā
translated: Paulastya, Datta of the Atri lineage, Niraṃtra,

analyzed: paulahaḥ thārvarīvān ca ete saptarṣayaḥ tathā
translated: and Paulaha, Arvarīvān - these were the seven sages.

original: caitraḥ kiṃpuruṣa ścaiva kṛtānto vibhṛto raviḥ /
analyzed: caitraḥ kiṃpuruṣaḥ ca eva kṛtāntaḥ vibhṛtaḥ raviḥ
translated: Caitra, Kimpuruṣa, Kṛtānta, Vibhṛta, Ravi,

original: bṛhaduktho navaḥ setuḥ śrutaśceti nava smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: bṛhadukthaḥ navaḥ setuḥ śrutaḥ ca iti nava smṛtāḥ

translated: He gave ten to Dharma, thirteen to Kaśyapa,
