translated: and twenty-seven to the moon, engaged in the measurement of time.

analyzed: ebhyaḥ dattvā tatas nyāḥ vai catasraḥ riṣṭanemine
translated: Having given them, he gave four others to Ariṣṭanemi,

original: dve caiva bahuputrāya dve caivāṅgirase tathā // / / //
analyzed: dve ca eva bahuputrāya dve ca eva aṅgirase tathā
translated: two to Bahuputra, and two to Aṅgiras.

analyzed: kanyām ekām kṛśāśvāya babhūva ha
translated: He gave one daughter to Kṛśāśva. They had offspring.

original: antaraṃ cākṣuṣasyātha manoḥ ṣaṣṭhaṃ tu gīyate // / / //
analyzed: antaram cākṣuṣasya atha manoḥ ṣaṣṭham tu gīyate
translated: The period between Cākṣuṣa and the sixth Manu is sung about.

analyzed: manoḥ vaivasvatasya api saptamasya prajāpateḥ
translated: Of the seventh Manu Vaivasvata, the lord of creatures,

analyzed: vasu devāḥ khagāḥ gāvaḥ nāgāḥ ditija dānavāḥ
translated: the Vasus, birds, cows, serpents, Daityas, Dānavas,

analyzed: gandharva apsarasaḥ ca eva jajñire nyāḥ ca jātayaḥ
translated: Gandharvas, Apsarās, and other species were born.

analyzed: tatas prabhṛti loke smin prajāḥ maithuna saṃbhavāḥ
translated: From that time forth, in this world, creatures were born by sexual intercourse.

analyzed: saṃkalpāt darśanāt sparśāt pūrvāsām sṛṣṭiḥ ucyate
translated: The creation of the first ones is said to be by will, sight, touch, and sexual intercourse.

original: ṛṣiruvāca🔽devānāṃ dānavānāṃ ca devarṣiṇāṃ ca te śubhaḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ uvāca  devānām dānavānām ca devarṣiṇām ca te śubhaḥ
translated: The Rishi said:

original: saṃbhavaḥ kathitaḥ pūrvaṃ dakṣasya ca mahātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃbhavaḥ kathitaḥ pūrvam dakṣasya ca mahātmanaḥ
translated: You have told us the auspicious origin of the gods, demons, and divine sages, and also of the great soul Daksha.

analyzed: prāṇāt prajāpateḥ janma dakṣasya kathitam tvayā
translated: You have told us how Daksha, the lord of creatures, was born from Prajapati's breath.

original: kathaṃ prāce tastvaṃ ca punarlebhe mahātapāḥ // / / //
analyzed: katham ca punar lebhe mahā tapāḥ
translated: But how did he, the great ascetic, again obtain the status of a Prajapati?

original: etaṃ naḥ saṃśayaṃ sūta vyākhyātuṃ tvamihārhasi /
analyzed: etam naḥ saṃśayam sūta vyākhyātum tvam iha arhasi
translated: O Suta, you should explain to us this doubt of ours.

analyzed: dauhitraḥ ca eva somasya katham śrvaśura tām gataḥ
translated: How did he, who was the grandson of Soma, become the father-in-law of Soma?

analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

analyzed: utpattiḥ ca nirodhaḥ ca nityam bhūteṣu sattamāḥ
translated: O best of beings, birth and death are always present in creatures.

original: ṛṣayo 'tra na suhyanti vidyāvantaśca ye janāḥ // / / //🔽yuge yuge bhavantyete sarve dakṣādayo dvijāḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ tra na suhyanti vidyāvantaḥ ca ye janāḥ  yuge yuge bhavanti ete sarve dakṣa ādayaḥ dvijāḥ
translated: The sages and the learned people do not grieve over this.

analyzed: punar ca eva nirudhyante vidvān tatra na muhyati
translated: O Brahmanas, Daksha and others are born in every Yuga and they cease to exist again. The wise man is not deluded by this.

analyzed: jyaiṣṭhya kāniṣṭhyam api eṣām pūrvam āsīt dvijottamāḥ
translated: O best of Brahmanas, they had seniority and inferiority in the beginning.

analyzed: tapaḥ eva garīyaḥ bhūt prabhāvaḥ ca eva kāraṇam
translated: Austerity alone became the most important, and power was the cause.

original: imāṃ visṛṣṭiṃ yo veda cākṣuṣasya carācaram /
analyzed: imām visṛṣṭim yaḥ veda cākṣuṣasya carācaram
translated: One who knows this creation of the Cākṣuṣa Manvantara, with its moving and unmoving beings,

analyzed: prajāvān āyuṣaḥ tīrṇaḥ svarga loke mahīyate
translated: becomes endowed with offspring, long life, and crosses over to heaven, where he is honored.

analyzed: evam sargaḥ samākhyātaḥ cākṣuṣasya samāsatas
translated: Thus the creation of the Cākṣuṣa Manvantara has been described in brief.

analyzed: iti ete ṣaṭ nisargāḥ ca krāntāḥ manvantara ātmakāḥ
translated: Thus these six creations, consisting of the Manvantaras, have been described.

original: svāyaṃbhuvādyāḥ saṃkṣepāccāśuṣāntā yathākramam /🔽ete sargā yathā prājñaiḥ proktā ye dvijasattamāḥ // / / //
analyzed: svāyaṃbhuva ādyāḥ saṃkṣepāt ca aśuṣa antāḥ yathākramam  ete sargāḥ yathā prājñaiḥ proktāḥ ye dvijasattamāḥ
translated: Beginning with the Svāyambhuva Manvantara and ending with the Cākṣuṣa Manvantara, in due order,🔽these creations have been described by the wise, O best of the twice-born.

analyzed: vaivasvata nisargeṇa teṣām jñeyaḥ tu vistaraḥ
translated: Their details should be known in accordance with the creation of Vaivasvata Manu.

original: anyūnānatiriktāste sarve sargā vivasvataḥ // / / //🔽ārogyāyuḥ pramāṇebhyo dharmataḥ kāmator'thataḥ /
analyzed: anyūna anatiriktāḥ te sarve sargāḥ vivasvataḥ  ārogya āyuḥ pramāṇebhyaḥ dharmataḥ kāmataḥ ṛthataḥ
translated: All these creations of Vivasvat are neither less nor more.

original: etāneva guṇāneti yaḥ paṭhannanasūyakaḥ // / / //🔽vaivasvatasya vakṣyāmi sāṃpratasya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: etān eva guṇān eti yaḥ paṭhan anasūyakaḥ  vaivasvatasya vakṣyāmi sāṃpratasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: One who reads this without malice attains these very qualities - health, longevity, moral virtue, desire, and wealth.🔽I shall now describe the present Vaivasvata Manu, the great soul.

analyzed: samāsa vyāsataḥ sargam bruvataḥ me nibodhata
translated: Listen to me as I describe his creation in brief and detail.

original: iti śrībrahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyuprokte pūrvabhāge dvitīye 'nuṣaṅgapāde cākṣuṣasargavarṇanaṃ nāma saptatriṃśattamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī brahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyu prokte pūrva bhāge dvitīye nuṣaṅga pāde cākṣuṣasargavarṇanam nāma saptatriṃśattamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirty-seventh chapter in the first section of the first part of the Mahabharata, called the Brahmanda Purana, narrated by the great sage Vyasa to his disciple, the son of Satyavati.

analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

analyzed: saptame tu atha paryāye manoḥ vaivasvatasya ha
translated: In the seventh Manvantara of Vaivasvata,

analyzed: mārīcāt kaśyapāt devāḥ jajñire parama ṛṣayaḥ
translated: the gods and great sages were born from Marichi Kashyapa.

original: ādityā vasavī rudrāḥ sādhyā viśve marudgaṇāḥ /
analyzed: ādityāḥ vasavī rudrāḥ sādhyāḥ viśve marut gaṇāḥ
translated: The Adityas, Vasus, Rudras, Sadhyas, Vishvadevas, Maruts,

analyzed: bhṛgavaḥ oṃgirasaḥ ca eva te deva gaṇāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: Bhrigus, and Angiras are known as the eight groups of gods.

analyzed: ādityāḥ marutaḥ rudrāḥ vijñeyāḥ kaśyapa ātmajāḥ
translated: The Adityas, Maruts, and Rudras should be known as the sons of Kashyapa,

analyzed: sādhya aśya vasavaḥ viśve dharma putrāḥ trayaḥ gaṇāḥ
translated: the Sadhyas, Vasus, and Vishvadevas are the three groups of Dharma's sons.

analyzed: bhṛgoḥ tu bhṛgavaḥ devāḥ hi aṅgirasā uṃgiraḥ sutāḥ
translated: The gods of the Bhrigus are the sons of Bhrigu, and the sons of Angiras are the Angiras.

analyzed: vaivasvata iṃtare hi asmin nitye te chanda jāḥ matāḥ
translated: In this Vaivasvata Manvantara, they are considered to be born from the Vedas.

analyzed: ete ca gamiṣyanti mahāntam kāla paryayāt
translated: But even they will pass away after a long period of time.

original: evaṃ sargastu mārīco vijñeyaḥ sāṃprataḥ śubhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: evam sargaḥ tu mārīcaḥ vijñeyaḥ sāṃprataḥ śubhaḥ
translated: Thus, the present auspicious creation of Marichi should be known.

analyzed: tejasvī sāṃprataḥ teṣām indraḥ nāmnā mahā balaḥ
translated: The present Indra, of great strength, is named Tvashtri.

original: atītānāgatā ye ca varttante sāṃprataṃ ca ye // / / //
analyzed: atīta anāgatāḥ ye ca varttante sāṃpratam ca ye
translated: Those who have passed away, those who will come in the future, and those who are present now,

analyzed: sarve manvantara idrāḥ te vijñeyāḥ tulya lakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all the lords of the Manvantaras should be known to have similar characteristics.

analyzed: bhūta bhavya bhavat nāthāḥ sahasrākṣāḥ purandarāḥ
translated: The lords of the past, present, and future, the thousand-eyed Purandaras,

analyzed: saghavantaḥ ca te sarve śṛṅgiṇaḥ vajra pāṇayaḥ
translated: all of them have horns, are armed with thunderbolts, and have the speed of mind.

analyzed: sarvaiḥ kratu śatena iṣṭam tu
translated: They have all performed a hundred sacrifices separately, each with a hundred times the normal offerings.

original: trailokye yāni sattvāni gatimanti dhruvāṇi ca /
analyzed: trailokye yāni sattvāni gatimanti dhruvāṇi ca
translated: Whatever beings there are in the three worlds, whether moving or stationary,

original: abhibhūyāvatiṣṭhanti dharmādyaiḥ kāraṇairapi // / / //🔽tejasā tapasā buddhyā balaśrutaparākramaiḥ /
analyzed: abhibhūya avatiṣṭhanti dharma ādyaiḥ kāraṇaiḥ api  tejasā tapasā buddhyā bala śruta parākramaiḥ
translated: they stand out and prevail over others by virtue of their righteousness and other qualities.🔽By their splendor, austerities, wisdom, strength, learning, and valor,

analyzed: bhūta bhavya bhavat nāthāḥ yathā te prabhaviṣṇavaḥ
translated: the lords of the past, present, and future are powerful.

analyzed: etat sarvam pravakṣyāmi bruvataḥ me nibodhata
translated: I will tell you all this, listen to me as I speak.

analyzed: bhūta bhavya bhavat hi etat samṛtam lokatrayam dvijaiḥ
translated: The past, present, and future are known as the three worlds by the twice-born.

analyzed: bhūrlokaḥ yam smṛtaḥ bhūtam antarikṣam bhavat smṛtam
translated: This world is known as the world of earth, the space in between is known as the world of existence,

original: bhavyaṃ smṛtaṃ divaṃ hyetatteṣāṃ vakṣyāmi sādhanam // / / //
analyzed: bhavyam smṛtam divam hi etat teṣām vakṣyāmi sādhanam
translated: and heaven is known as the world of the future. I will tell you their means of attainment.

analyzed: dhyāyatā lokanāmāni brahmaṇā agre vibhāṣitam
translated: The names of the worlds were contemplated and explained by Brahma in the beginning.

original: bhūriti vyāhṛtaṃ pūrvaṃ bhūrloko 'yamabhūttadā // / / //🔽bhū sattāyāṃ smṛto dhātustathāsau lokadarśane /
analyzed: bhūḥ iti vyāhṛtam pūrvam bhūḥ lokaḥ yam abhūt tadā  sattāyām smṛtaḥ dhātuḥ tathā asau loka darśane
translated: The syllable bhūḥ was uttered first, and this became the world of Bhūḥ.🔽The root bhū is known to mean existence, and so is this world seen.

original: bhūtatvāddarśanāccaiva bhūrloko 'yamabhūttataḥ // / / //🔽ato 'yaṃ prathamo loko bhūtatvādbhūrdvajaiḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: bhūta tvāt darśanāt ca eva bhūḥ lokaḥ yam abhūt tatas  atas yam prathamaḥ lokaḥ bhūta tvāt bhūḥ dvajaiḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Because of being existent and being seen, this became the world of Bhūḥ.🔽Therefore, this is the first world, remembered as Bhū by the twice-born because of being existent.

analyzed: bhūte smin bhavat iti uktam dvitīyam brahmaṇā punar
translated: In this existent, bhavat was uttered again by Brahmā.

original: bhavadityatpadyamāne kāle śabdo 'yamucyate /🔽bhavanāttu bhuvalloko niruttayā hi nirucyate // / / //
analyzed: bhavat iti at padyamāne kāle śabdaḥ yam ucyate  bhavanāt tu bhuvat lokaḥ niruttayā hi nirucyate
translated: The word bhavat is said to be used when time is about to arise.🔽The world of Bhuva is indeed described by etymology as bhavat because of existence.

analyzed: antarikṣam bhavat tasmāt dvitīyaḥ lokaḥ ucyate
translated: The second world is said to be the sky, because it exists.

original: utpanne tu tathā loke dvitīye brahmaṇā punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: utpanne tu tathā loke dvitīye brahmaṇā punar
translated: When the second world was created by Brahmā again,

analyzed: bhavyā iti vyāhṛtam paścāt bhavyaḥ lokaḥ tatas bhavat
translated: bhavya was uttered later, and then the world of Bhavya came into being.

original: anāgate bhavya ita śabda eṣa vibhāvyate // / / //
analyzed: anāgate bhavye ita śabdaḥ eṣa vibhāvyate
translated: This word bhavya is seen to be used in the future.

analyzed: tasmāt bhavyaḥ hi asau lokaḥ nāmataḥ tridivam smṛtam
translated: Therefore, that world is indeed called Bhavya, and is remembered as heaven by name.

analyzed: bhūḥ iti iyam smṛtā bhūmiḥ antarikṣam bhuvaḥ smṛtam
translated: Bhūḥ is remembered as this earth, and bhuvaḥ is remembered as the sky.

original: divaṃ smṛtaṃ tathā bhavyaṃ tralokyasyaiṣa nirṇayaḥ /
analyzed: divam smṛtam tathā bhavyam tralokyasya eṣa nirṇayaḥ
translated: The heaven is remembered as Bhavyam. This is the determination of the three worlds.

analyzed: trailokya yuktaiḥ vyāhāraiḥ tisraḥ vyāhṛtayaḥ bhavan
translated: The three Vyāhṛtis arose from the utterances associated with the three worlds.

original: nātha ityeṣa dhāturvai dhātujñaiḥ pālane smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: nāthaḥ iti eṣa dhātuḥ vai dhātu jñaiḥ pālane smṛtaḥ
translated: This root 'nātha' is indeed remembered by those who know the roots as denoting protection.

analyzed: yasmāt bhūtasya lokasya bhavyasya bhavataḥ tathā
translated: Because he is the lord of the existing world, the future world, and the world that is becoming.

analyzed: lokatrayasya nāthāḥ te tasmāt indrāt vijaiḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: They are remembered as Indra and others by the Brahmins as the lords of the three worlds.

analyzed: pradhāna bhūtāḥ deva indrāḥ guṇa bhūtāḥ tathā eva ca
translated: The lords of the gods are the principal ones, and they are also the secondary ones.

original: manvantareṣu ye devā yajñabhājo bhavanti hi /
analyzed: manvantareṣu ye devāḥ yajña bhājaḥ bhavanti hi
translated: Those who become the gods in the Manvantaras and enjoy the shares in the sacrifices,

analyzed: yajña gandharva rakṣāṃsi piśācaḥ raga mānuṣāḥ
translated: The Yajña Gandharvas, Rākṣasas, Piśācas, Uragas, and human beings,

original: mahimānaḥ smṛtā hyete devendrāṇāṃ tu sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: mahimānaḥ smṛtāḥ hi ete deva indrāṇām tu sarvaśas
translated: Are remembered as having greatness in every way of the lords of the gods.

original: devendrā guravo nāthā rājānaḥ pitaro hi te // / / //
analyzed: deva indrāḥ guravaḥ nāthāḥ rājānaḥ pitaraḥ hi te
translated: The lords of the gods, the preceptors, the lords, the kings, and the ancestors,

analyzed: rakṣanti imāḥ prajāḥ hi ete dharmeṇa iha sura uttamāḥ
translated: Protect these beings here in this world through righteousness, O best of the gods.

analyzed: iti etat lakṣaṇam proktam deva indrāṇām samāsatas
translated: Thus the characteristics of the lords of the gods have been stated in brief.

analyzed: saptarṣīn saṃpravakṣyāmi sāṃpratam ye divam śritāḥ
translated: I will now describe the seven sages who have gone to heaven.

analyzed: gādhijaḥ kauśikaḥ dhīmān viśvāmitraḥ mahā tapāḥ
translated: The son of Gadhi, the wise Vishvamitra of great austerities,

analyzed: bhārgavaḥ jamadagniḥ ca hi aurva putraḥ pratāpavān
translated: The powerful son of Aurva, Jamadagni of the Bhrigu lineage,

analyzed: bṛhaspati sutaḥ ca api bharadvājaḥ mahā yaśāḥ
translated: The greatly famous Bharadvaja, the son of Brihaspati,

analyzed: autathyaḥ gautamaḥ vidvān śaradvān nāma dhārmikaḥ
translated: The learned Gautama of the Autri clan, the righteous one named Sharadvan,

analyzed: svāyaṃbhuvaḥ tris bhagavān brahma kośaḥ sa pañcamaḥ
translated: The self-born lord Atri, the fifth one who is the treasure of Brahman,

analyzed: ṣaṣṭhaḥ vasiṣṭha putraḥ tu vasumān loka viśrutaḥ
translated: The sixth one, the son of Vasishtha, known in the world as Vasuman,

analyzed: vatsaraḥ saptā ete sādhu saṃmatāḥ
translated: And Vatsara, the son of Kashyapa - these seven are considered virtuous.

original: ete saptarṣayaśyoktā varttante sāṃprateṃ'tare /🔽ikṣvākuśca nṛgaścaiva dhṛṣṭaḥ śaryātireba ca // / / //
analyzed: ete saptarṣayaḥ ca uktāḥ varttante  ikṣvākuḥ ca nṛgaḥ ca eva dhṛṣṭaḥ śaryātiḥ eba ca
translated: These seven sages are mentioned as present in the current eon.🔽Ikshvaku, Nriga, Dhristaketu, Sharyati,

analyzed: nariṣyantaḥ ca vikhyātaḥ nābhāgaḥ diṣṭaḥ eva ca
translated: The famous Nari-shyanta, Nabhaga, and Dhi-shta,

analyzed: karūṣaḥ ca pṛṣadhraḥ ca pāṃśuḥ ca navamaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Karusha, Prishadhra, and Panshu are remembered as the ninth,

analyzed: manoḥ vaivasvatasya ete nava putrāḥ su dhārmikāḥ
translated: These nine sons of Manu Vaivasvata are highly righteous.

original: kīrtitā vai tathā hyete saptamaṃ caitadantaram // / / //
analyzed: kīrtitāḥ vai tathā hi ete saptamam ca etat antaram
translated: Thus these are mentioned, and this is the seventh eon.

original: ityeṣa ha mayā pādo dvitīyaḥ kathitodvijāḥ /
analyzed: iti eṣa ha mayā pādaḥ dvitīyaḥ kathitaḥ dvijāḥ
translated: Thus, O twice-born ones, this second quarter has been narrated by me.

original: vistareṇānupūrvyā ca bhūyaḥ kiṃ kathayāmyaham // / / //🔽iti śrībrahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyuprokte pūrvabhāge dvitīye 'nuṣaṅgapāde manvantaravarṇanaṃ nāmāṣṭātriṃśattamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: vistareṇa ānupūrvyā ca bhūyas kim kathayāmi aham  iti śrī brahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyu prokte pūrva bhāge dvitīye nuṣaṅga pāde manvantaravarṇanam nāma aṣṭātriṃśattamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: In detail and in due order, what more shall I narrate?

analyzed: samāptaḥ yam brahmāṇḍa mahāpurāṇa pūrva bhāgaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirty-eighth chapter, in the second section of the first part, of the Srimad Brahma-Aṇḍa Mahā-Purāṇa, narrated by Vāyu.
